sollicitudo: <entryFree id="n44658" type="main" key="solli^ci^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sollĭcĭtūdo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sōlic-</orth>), <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sollicitus, II.</etym>, <sense id="n44658.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">uneasiness of mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">care</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disquiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anxiety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solicitude</hi> (class.; used equally in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: aegritudo, dolor, anxietas): sollicitudo aegritudo cum cogitatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:8:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus nunc me esse experior summae sollicitudini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istaec mihi res sollicitudini'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem afficere curā et sollicitudine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita vacua metu, curā, sollicitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:16:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 16, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:40:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 40, 96</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitudo animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:18:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 18, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitudinem falsam mittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed dices, me ipsum mihi sollicitudinem struere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne tu me sollicitudine magnā liberaris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duplex nos afficit sollicitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:97:332" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 97, 332</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi sollicitudinem adferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitudinem sustineo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaenam sollicitudo vexaret impios sublato suppliciorum metu?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:14:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 14, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitudine provinciae urgebamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te torquerier omni Sollicitudine districtum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 68</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. Polyb. 4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. Polyb. 4</bibl> (23), 2 et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 1, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:21:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 21, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:16:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 16, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:72:150" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 72, 150</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 18, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 18, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:13:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 13, 10</bibl>.—Prov.: amor otiosae causa est sollicitudinis, Publ. Syr. v. 34 Rib.—</sense><sense id="n44658.1" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen. obj.</hi>: nuptiarum,<cb n="SOLL" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmarum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>care lest they be broken to pieces</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 1, 6, § 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44658.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">care</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forethought</hi>, <hi rend="ital">duty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">responsibility</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">cursūs vehicularis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:4:18" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitudinem cursualem agere, Cod. Th. 6, 29, 7: castella quae sollicitudo pervigil veterum per opportunos saltus erexit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 8, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sollicitus: <entryFree id="n44659" type="main" key="solli^ci^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sollĭcĭtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sōlĭcĭtus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sollus-cieo; cf. sollicito</etym>, <sense id="n44659.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thoroughly moved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agitated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturbed.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44659.1" n="I" level="1"> Of physical motion (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and rare). </sense><sense id="n44659.2" n="1" level="3"> As attrib. of motus, <hi rend="ital">restless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unceasing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae sollicito motu carerent, referring to the elements in constant motion, as air, water, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:343" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 343</bibl></cit>: sic igitur penitus qui in ferro'st abditus aër Sollicito motu semper jactatur, i. e. <hi rend="ital">an unceasing air-current within the iron</hi>, to explain its attraction by the magnet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1038" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 1038</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44659.3" n="2" level="3"> Of the sea agitated by storms: <cit><quote lang="la">ut mare sollicitum stridet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 262</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n44659.4" n="3" level="3"> Pregn., with the idea of distress (v. II. B.): <cit><quote lang="la">utile sollicitae sidus utrumque rati,</quote> <trans><tr>to a ship in distress</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:720" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 720</bibl></cit>: sollicitae porro plenaeque sonoribus aures, <hi rend="ital">agitated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vibrating</hi> (<hi rend="ital">by disease</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1185</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 1299" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 1299</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44659.5" n="4" level="3"> Sollicitum habere (cf. II. A. and B. infra), = sollicitare: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes sollicitos habui,</quote> <trans><tr>kept them busy</tr>, <tr>on the move</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 52</bibl></cit> Donat. ad loc.</sense><sense id="n44659.6" n="II" level="1"> Of mental affections, <hi rend="ital">full of anxiety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excitement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distracted by cares</hi>, <hi rend="ital">engaged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">troubled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturbed</hi> (opp. quietus). </sense><sense id="n44659.7" n="A" level="2"> Of cares of business; esp. sollicitum habere, <hi rend="ital">to keep busy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">engaged</hi> (Plaut. and Ter.): <cit><quote lang="la">(clientes) qui neque leges colunt, neque, etc., sollicitos patronos habent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 2, 12</bibl></cit> Brix ad loc.; <cit><quote lang="la">4, 2, 21: quorum negotiis nos absentum sollicitae noctes et dies sumus semper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hem, tot mea Solius solliciti sunt curā, of servants busy in attending their master,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 77</bibl></cit>: numquid vis? <hi rend="ital">Py.</hi> Ne magis sim pulcer quam sum: <cit><quote lang="la">ita me mea forma habet sollicitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 95</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Hispaniae armis sollicitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 48</bibl></cit> Dietsch. —</sense><sense id="n44659.8" n="B" level="2"> Of restlessness from fear, suspense, etc., <hi rend="ital">full of anxiety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agitated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alarmed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solicitous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anxious</hi> (opp. securus; freq. and class.): sollicitum habere, <hi rend="ital">to fill with apprehension and fear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep in anxiety;</hi> constr., </sense><sense id="n44659.9" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quibus si non erunt insidiae ... animus tamen erit sollicitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:11:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 11, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diutius videtur velle eos habere sollicitos a quibus se putat diuturnioribus esse molestiis conflictatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae maxime angere atque sollicitam habere vestram aetatem videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:19:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 19, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitum te habebat cogitatio periculi mei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 18, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 11, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">initia rerum quae ... sollicitam Italiam habebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum satis per se ipsum Samnitium bellum et, ... sollicitos haberet patres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 29, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solliciti et incerti rerum suarum Megaram referre signa jubent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:23:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 23, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitae ac suspensae civitati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 50 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid illis nos sollicitis ac pendentibus animi renuntiare jubetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:30:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 30, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitae mentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F 3, 362</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:13:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego percussorem meum securum ambulare patiar, me sollicito?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:9:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitus est et incertus sui quem spes aliqua proritat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 23:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 23, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sollicitus sim cum Saturnus et Mars ex contrario stabunt,</quote> <trans><tr>alarmed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 88:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 88, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fertur sollicitas tenuisse deas,</quote> <trans><tr>kept them in anxious suspense</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 2, 338</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc sollicitam timor anxius angit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 89</bibl></cit>.—And opposed to securus and securitas: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est turpius quam in ipso limine securitatis esse sollicitum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 22:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 22, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">securo nihil est te pejus, eodem Sollicito nihil est te melius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:83:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 83, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:31:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 31, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 124:19" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 124, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:151" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 151</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 58</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44659.10" n="2" level="3"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitam mihi civitatem suspitione, suspensam metu ... tradidistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sophocles, ancipiti sententiarum eventu diu sollicitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:12:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 12, 5</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi> —</sense><sense id="n44659.11" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitus eram de rebus urbanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de tuā valetudine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicita civitas de Etruriae defectione fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 21 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitum te esse scribis de judicii eventu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 24:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 24, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desii jam de te esse sollicitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 82:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 82, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44659.12" n="4" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">pro</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne necesse sit unum sollicitum esse pro pluribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:13:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 13, 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44659.13" n="5" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">propter</hi>: sollicitus propter <cb n="SOLL" /> iniquitatem locorum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:40:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 40, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 3, 5</bibl> infra.—</sense><sense id="n44659.14" n="6" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">adverb. acc. vicem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for the fate of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicito consuli et propter itineris difficultatem et eorum vicem, ... nuntius occurrit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut meam quoque, non solum reipublicae vicem videretur sollicitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:43:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 43, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamor undique ab sollicitis vicem imperatoris militibus sublatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:19:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 19, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44659.15" n="7" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sollicitus futuri, pendet (filius tuus mortuus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. Marc. 19:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. Marc. 19, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44659.16" n="8" level="3"> With <case>dat.</case> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">ne solliciti sitis animae vestrae, neque corpori vestro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 6, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44659.17" n="9" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex hoc misera sollicita'st, diem Quia olim in hunc, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec turba sollicita ex temerariā regis fiduciā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:1:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 1, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44659.18" n="10" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, like verbs of fearing: <cit><quote lang="la">(mater) sollicita est ne eundem conspiciat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:41:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 41, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legati Romanorum circuire urbes, solliciti ne Aetoli partis alicujus animos ad Antiochum avertissent,</quote> <trans><tr>apprehensive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:31:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 31, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitis populis ne suas operiant terras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 29, 35, § 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitus Solon, ne tacendo parum reipublicae consuleret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:7:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 7, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:1:6" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 1, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44659.19" n="11" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">interrog.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">solliciti erant quo evasura esset res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 21 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam sim sollicitus, quidnam futurum sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 6, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44659.20" n="C" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">troubled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturbed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">afflicted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grieved;</hi> constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, with <case>abl.</case> alone, or with <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitus mihi nescio quā re videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque est consentaneum ullam honestam rem, ne sollicitus sis ... deponere,</quote> <trans><tr>lest you be troubled by cares</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:13:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 13, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vehementer te esse sollicitum et praecipuo quodam dolore angi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vehementer populum sollicitum fuisse de P. Sullae morte,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">num eum postea censes anxio animo aut sollicito fuisse,</quote> <trans><tr>afflicted by remorse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:17:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 17, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc genus omne Maestum ac sollicitum est cantoris morte Tigelli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44659.21" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Excited</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passionate</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">qui, ut sint pudici, solliciti tamen et anxii sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:33:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 33, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atqui sollicitae nuntius hospitae, Suspirare Chloen .. Dicens, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 7, 9</bibl></cit>; so, = avidus, with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">de</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">hominem cuppedinis sollicitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de regno sollicitus ( = avidus regni potiundi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:10:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 10, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44659.22" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Very careful for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concerned in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">punctilious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">particular about</hi> (post-Aug.; freq.); constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">de</hi>, <hi rend="ital">circa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">obj.-inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne decet quidem, ubi maxima rerum monumenta versantur, de verbis esse sollicitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de quorum sumus judicio solliciti,</quote> <trans><tr>for whose judgment we care</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dixit Cicero, non se de ingenii famā, sed de fide esse sollicitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec sum in hoc sollicitus, dum res ipsa appareat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentia non in verba sollicita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:8:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tamen contingere eloquentia non sollicito potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 75:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 75, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur abis, non sollicitus prodesse bonis, nocere malis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 976" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Hippol. 976</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in double sense,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:83:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 83, 2</bibl></cit> and 5.—</sense><sense id="n44659.23" n="F" level="1"> = sollicitatus (v. sollicito; <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">solliciti jaceant terrāque premantur iniquā qui, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>without repose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:16:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 16, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n44659.24" n="III" level="1"> Of abstr. and inanim. things. </sense><sense id="n44659.25" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">solicitous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mournful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">full of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">connected with cares and anxiety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anxious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturbed</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">often approaching the signif. II.): scio quam timida sit ambitio, et quam sollicita sit cupiditas consulatūs,</quote> <trans><tr>how full of cares is the desire for the consulship</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:16:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 16, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id est proprium civitatis ut sit libera et non sollicita rei cujusque custodia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>that nobody be disturbed in the quiet possession of his property</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:22:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 22, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est enim metus futurae aegritudinis sollicita exspectatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:18:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 18, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam sit omnis amor sollicitus et anxius,</quote> <trans><tr>fraught with solicitude</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 24, 1</bibl></cit>: assentior, sollicitam et periculosam justitiam non esse sapientis, id. Fragm. Rep. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 801</bibl> P. (Rep. 3, 27, 39): sollicitam lucem rapuisti Ciceroni, <hi rend="ital">the mournful light</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">life</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:66" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sollicito civitatis statu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hermagoras, vir diligentiae nimium sollicitae,</quote> <trans><tr>evercareful</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:11:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 11, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitum dicendi propositum,</quote> <trans><tr>anxiously accurate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicita parentis diligentia,</quote> <trans><tr>earnest care</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6</bibl></cit>, prooem. 1; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:12:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 12, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitae actiones,</quote> <trans><tr>carefully elaborated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 57</bibl></cit>: causae sollicitae (opp. securae), <pb n="1723" /> <cb n="SOLL" /> <hi rend="ital">very doubtful cases</hi>, i. e. in which there is anxious suspense about the issue, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:151" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 151</bibl>: captarum (ferarum) sollicita possessio; <cit><quote lang="la">saepe enim laniant dominos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 14:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maxima quaeque bona sollicita sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 17:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 17, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 14:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 14, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctes, id. Ira, 2, 20, 1: tutela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. Marc. 11:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cons. Marc. 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitos fecisti, Romule, ludos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quisque, sibi quid sit Utile, sollicitis supputat articulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:3:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 2, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicito carcere dignus eras,</quote> <trans><tr>a prison carefully guarded</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:6:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 6, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cressa ... sollicito revocavit Thesea filo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:6:26" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 6, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:45:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 45, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 19</bibl></cit> (18), 196: <cit><quote lang="la">os,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:9:130" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 9, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:2:2" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">preces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:1:148" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 1, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:35:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 35, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 6, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:10:116" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 10, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:500" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 6, 500</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libelli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:58:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 58, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saccus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 60</bibl></cit> b, 3: <cit><quote lang="la">fuga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:1:50" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:1:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">via,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:11:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:786" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 15, 786</bibl></cit>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n44659.26" n="2" level="3"> = sollicitum habens, <hi rend="ital">that causes distress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distressing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trying</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid magis sollicitum dici potest,</quote> <trans><tr>what more distressing fact can be mentioned?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quā (tyrannorum) vitā nulla ... potest esse fiducia, omnia semper suspecta atque sollicita,</quote> <trans><tr>causing alarm</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:15:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 15, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitumque aliquid laetis intervenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:454" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 454</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o mihi sollicitum decus ac suprema voluptas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:363" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 363</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 519" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 519</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pretia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 461" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Herc. Fur. 461</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timor or metus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 1, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 76</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:2:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:11:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 11, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:5:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 5, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 922" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 922</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:374" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 374</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taedium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:14:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 14, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:10:11" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 10, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n44659.27" n="IV" level="1"> Of animals (rare): sollicitum animal (canis) ad nocturnos strepitus, <hi rend="ital">very attentive to</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">watchful</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:47:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 47, 3</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:599" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 599</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solliciti terrentur equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:741" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 741</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lepus,</quote> <trans><tr>timid</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:372" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 372</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n44659.28" n="V" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: sollicitior (mostly post-Aug.; for which Cic. has magis sollicitus; v. III. 2. supra) homo, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 18, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos circa lites raras sollicitiores,</quote> <trans><tr>too particular about</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitior rei familiaris diligentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">innocentiam sollicitiore habituri loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:13:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(pauperes) sollicitiores divitibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. Helv. 12:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cons. Helv. 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod est sollicitius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 1:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tranq. 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui non sollicitior de capitis sui decore sit quam de salute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 12:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brev. Vit. 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro vobis sollicitior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 58</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> (post-Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">illorum brevissima ac sollicitissima aetas est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 16:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 16, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sollĭcĭtē</orth> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n44659.29" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Carefully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">punctiliously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anxiously</hi>: vestis nec servata, nec sumenda sollicite, Ser. Samm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 1:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 1, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in conviviis lingua sollicite etiam ebriis custodienda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:26:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 26, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exspectatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 3:12:1" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 3, 12, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 103" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aquaed. 103</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitius et intentius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">custodiendus est honor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 1:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 19, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cavere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 274, 35</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbis curam sollicitissime agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44659.30" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">With grief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solicitude</hi> (class.: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicito animo): sollicite possidentur,</quote> <trans><tr>their possession is connected with solicitude</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 76:30" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 76, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:572" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 572</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 93:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 93, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sollicuria: <entryFree id="n44660" type="gloss" key="solli^cu_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sollĭcūrĭa</orth> <itype>in omni re curiosa</itype>, Fest. s. v. sollo, p. 298 Müll.</entryFree>
solliferreum: <entryFree id="n44661" type="main" key="solli^ferreum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sollĭferreum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sōlĭf-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. telum) [sollus-, i. e. totus-ferrum], <sense id="n44661.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a missile weapon made wholly of iron</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an iron javelin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:25:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 25, 2</bibl>; cf. Fest. s. v. sollo, p. 298 Müll.; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=299" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 299</bibl> ib.; and s. v. solitaurilia, p. 293 ib.</sense></entryFree>
sollistimus: <entryFree id="n44662" type="main" key="sollisti^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sollistĭmus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sōlist-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>old <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> form of sollus = salvus; v. Corss. Krit. Beitr. p. 313 sq.</etym>, <sense id="n44662.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">most perfect</hi>, only in the expression tripudium sollistimum, in augural lang.; <hi rend="ital">the most favorable omen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">when the chickens ate so greedily that the corn fell from their bills to the ground</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=298" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 298</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:15:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 15, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 34, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 40</bibl>; cf. Becker, Antiq. II. pt. 3, p. 79; and Lange, Antiq. I. p. 257.</sense></entryFree>
sollus: <entryFree id="n44663" type="gloss" key="sollus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sollus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cf. Sanscr. sarva, entire; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">o(/los</foreign>; Lat. salvus; v. Corss. Krit. Beitr. p. 313</etym>, <sense id="n44663.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">whole</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unbroken</hi>: vasa quoque omnino redimit non solla dupundi, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=298" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 298</bibl> (Sat. v. 38 Gerl.): sollum Osce totum et solitum significat, unde tela quaedam solliferrea vocantur tota ferrea, et homo bonarum artium sollers, etc., Fest. s. v. solitaurilia, p. 293 Müll.; cf. Paul. ex <cb n="SOLO" /> Fest. s. v. sollo, p. 298 ib. (v. also the com. pounds sollennis, sollers, sollistimus, and sollicitus).</sense></entryFree>
solo: <entryFree id="n44664" type="main" key="so_lo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>solus</etym>, <sense id="n44664.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make lonely</hi> or <hi rend="ital">desolate; to lay waste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desolate</hi> (only a few times in the post-Aug. poets): <cit><quote lang="la">urbes populis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:36" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 149</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n44665" type="main" key="So^lo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŏlo</orth>, v. 1. Solon.</entryFree>
soloe: <entryFree id="n44666" type="main" key="So^loe"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŏloe</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dissyl.</orth>), v. Soli, I. and II.</entryFree>
soloecismus: <entryFree id="n44667" type="greek" key="so^loecismus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏloecismus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏlĭcismus</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 138</bibl>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">soloikismo/s</foreign>. <sense id="n44667.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a grammatical fault in the construction of a sentence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a solecism</hi> (cf. stribligo): <cit><quote lang="la">vitia in sermone, quo minus is Latinus sit, duo possunt esse: soloecismus et barbarismus. Soloecismus est, cum in verbis pluribus consequens verbum superiori non accommodatur. Barbarismus est, cum verbum aliquod vitiose effertur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 12, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. Sinn. Capito ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:20:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 20, 1</bibl> (who called it, in pure Latin, imparilitas); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:36" default="NO">1, 5, 36</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 2:section=13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Suas. 2, § 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:7:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:452" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 452</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 138</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Nat. 1, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44667.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a fault</hi>, in gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:19:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 19, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud Christianos soloecismus est magnus et vitium, turpe quid vel narrare vel facere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Helv. 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
soloecista: <entryFree id="n44668" type="greek" key="so^loecista"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏloecista</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">soloikisth/s</foreign>, <sense id="n44668.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that speaks faultily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that commits solecisms</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Ruf. 3, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
soloecophanes: <entryFree id="n44669" type="greek" key="so^loeco^pha^ne^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏloecŏphănĕs</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">soloikofane/s</foreign>, <sense id="n44669.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which appears to be a solecism</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Or. 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
soloecum: <entryFree id="n44670" type="greek" key="so^loecum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏloecum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">so/loikon</foreign>, = soloecismus, Auct. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:20:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 20, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:2:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 2, 11</bibl>.</entryFree>
solon: <entryFree id="n44671" type="main" key="So^lon1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŏlon</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŏlo</orth> (the latter in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 1, 2</bibl>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*so/lwn</foreign>. <sense id="n44671.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A famous legislator of the Athenians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one of the seven sages of Greece</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:7:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 7, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:44:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 44, 197</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:23:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 23, 59</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 25, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:274" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 274</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aerumnosi Solones,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>philosophers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:79 al" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 79 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n44671.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A commander in Pydna</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n44672" type="main" key="So^lo_n2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŏlōn</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*solw/nion</foreign>, <sense id="n44672.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of the Allobroges</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in</hi> Gallia Narbonensis, <hi rend="ital">north-west of the Rhodanus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perh. near the modern Sortie</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 103</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
solonates: <entryFree id="n44673" type="main" key="So^lona_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŏlonātes</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44673.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Gallic tribe in</hi> Gallia Cisalpina, <hi rend="ital">south-west of Forum Julii</hi>, now probably <hi rend="ital">Torre di Sole</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 15, 20, § 116</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 5124</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
solonium: <entryFree id="n44674" type="main" key="Soloni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Solonĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n44674.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a district near Lanuvium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Via Ostiensis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:36:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 36, 79</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 31, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 3, 3</bibl>.—Called also Solonius ager, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 12</bibl>; Fest. s. v. pomonal, p. 250, b. Müll.</sense></entryFree>
solor: <entryFree id="n44675" type="main" key="so_lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōlor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n44675.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44675.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To comfort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">console</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solace</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; <cit><quote lang="la">while consolor is class.): diffidentem verbis solatur suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lenire dolentem Solando cupit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:394" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 394</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos bonus Aeneas dictis solatur amicis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 770</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:237" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 237</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inopem et aegrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 131</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 290</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:38:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 38, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solantia tollite verba!</quote> <trans><tr>your words of comfort</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:685" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 685</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solandus cum simul ipse fores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:4:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 4, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et Caesar quamvis posthabitam deciens sestertii dote solatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 86</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44675.2" n="II" level="1"> With inanim. and abstr. objects, <hi rend="ital">to soothe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ease</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lighten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lessen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relieve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assuage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mitigate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">famem concussā quercu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluviis gravem aestum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laborem cantu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 293</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aegrum testudine amorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 464</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:489" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 9, 489</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:821" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 821</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">singulorum fatigatio quamlibet se rudi modulatione solatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desiderium fratris amissi aut nepote ejus aut nepte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cladem Lugdunensem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis repulsam propinqua spes soletur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
solorius: <entryFree id="n44676" type="main" key="Solorius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Solorius</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44676.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain in</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 1, 2, § 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
solox: <entryFree id="n44677" type="main" key="so^lox"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏlox</orth>, <itype>ōcis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (cf.: salvus, solidus; v. Corss. Ausspr. 1, 486; ante- and post-class.). <sense id="n44677.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of raw, unwrought wool, <hi rend="ital">of a coarse staple</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coarse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harsh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bristly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">solox, lana crassa, et pecus, quod passim pascitur non tectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=301" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 301</bibl></cit> Müll.: lana, Titin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:1" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> 1</bibl>. 1.: pecore hirto atque soloce, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:1" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> 1</bibl>. 1.; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=300" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 300</bibl> Müll.: solox, <foreign lang="greek">e)/rion paxu/</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.: <cit><quote lang="la">pallium philosophorum soloci lana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:Eloq. p. 228" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author> Eloq. p. 228</bibl></cit> Mai.—* </sense><sense id="n44677.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">solox</orth>, <cb n="SOLU" /> <itype>ōcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. vestis), <hi rend="ital">a dress of coarse woollen stuff</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>—* </sense><sense id="n44677.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">elaboratam filo soloci accipe cantilenam,</quote> <trans><tr>coarse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 1, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">munusculum levidense crasso filo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 12, 2</bibl></cit>).</sense></entryFree>
solpuga: <entryFree id="n44678" type="main" key="solpu_ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">solpūga</orth>, v. solipuga.</entryFree>
solsequium: <entryFree id="n44679" type="main" key="solsequi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">solsequĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n44679.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> heliotropium, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
solstitialis: <entryFree id="n44680" type="main" key="solsti^ti^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">solstĭtĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>solstitium</etym>. <sense id="n44680.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the summer solstice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solstitial</hi> (opp. brumalis): <cit><quote lang="la">(sol) Brumales adeat flexus, atque inde revortens Cancri se ut vortat metas ad solstitiales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:617" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 617</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <trans><tr>the day on which the sun enters Cancer</tr>, <tr>the longest day</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:39:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 39, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:790" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 790</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the shortest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:4:26" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 4, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ortus sideris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:7:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circulus,</quote> <trans><tr>the tropic of Cancer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=24" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 24</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 11, 8, § 50</bibl>.—Called also orbis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:14:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 14, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exortus,</quote> <trans><tr>the point where the sun rises at the summer solstice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:333" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 34, 77, § 333</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44680.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44680.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to midsummer</hi> or <hi rend="ital">summer heat</hi>: herba, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a summer plant</hi> or <hi rend="ital">one that quickly withers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Prof. 6, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 5, 14, § 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:17:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 16, 18, § 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 49</bibl></cit> Drak.: <cit><quote lang="la">caput Leonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:338" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 338</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbus,</quote> <trans><tr>the midsummer fever</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 143</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44680.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the sun</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solar</hi> (for solaris): <cit><quote lang="la">annus, qui solstitiali circumagitur orbe,</quote> <trans><tr>in a solar revolution</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:19:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 19, 6</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which, annus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> A. 4, 653</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plaga,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the south</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
solstitium: <entryFree id="n44681" type="main" key="solsti^ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">solstĭtĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sol-sisto</etym>. <sense id="n44681.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">the time when the sun seems to stand still</hi>, either in Cancer or in Capricorn, <hi rend="ital">the</hi> (summer or winter) <hi rend="ital">solstice</hi> (so in gen. not till after the Aug. period): <cit><quote lang="la">solstitium aestivum ... hibernum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestivum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 229</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brumale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:94" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solstitia et aequinoctia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:14:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 14, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44681.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">the summer solstice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the longest day of the year</hi> (opp. bruma, the prevalent signif. of the word): <cit><quote lang="la">alter motus solis est ... a brumā ad solstitium. Solstitium quod sol eo die sistere videbatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 8</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:28:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 28, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:1:1:46" default="NO">1, 1, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:7:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 7, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 19, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:44:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 44, 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 43, 68, § 167</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:264 al" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 28, 68, § 264 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n44681.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">summer time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the heat of summer</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; cf. bruma, 2.): paenula solstitio, campestre nivalibus auris <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:10:7" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 10, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:12:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 12, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solstitium pecori defendite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
solubilis: <entryFree id="n44682" type="main" key="so^lu_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏlūbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>solvo</etym> (post-class.). <sense id="n44682.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that may be loosed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">taken apart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissolvable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pons,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 8, 10</bibl></cit>: mundus, Min. Oct. 34: caro, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 506. —* </sense><sense id="n44682.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loosening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relaxing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:37:192" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 37, 192</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
solum: <entryFree id="n44683" type="main" key="so^lum1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏlus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:1:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, 1, 2</bibl>), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>root sar-, to guard, make whole; Sanscr. Sarva, entire; cf.: solea, solidus, sollus</etym>, <sense id="n44683.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the lowest part</hi> of a thing, <hi rend="ital">the bottom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">base</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foundation.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44683.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the floor</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pavement</hi> of a room; <hi rend="ital">the bottom</hi> of a ditch or trench; <hi rend="ital">the foundation</hi> of a building or <hi rend="ital">the ground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">site</hi>, on which it stands, etc.; <hi rend="ital">ground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">earth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">land</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soil; the sole</hi> of the foot or of a shoe, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">aurata tecta in villis et sola marmorea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:3:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 6, 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(templi) Marmoreum solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:672" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 672</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:3:16" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 3, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ejus (fossae) solum tantundem pateret, quantum summa labra distabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imum stagni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:298" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 298</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 475" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 475</bibl></cit>.—Of a river-bed: <cit><quote lang="la">puro solo excipitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:4:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 4, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:3:2" default="NO">5, 3, 2</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi mollius solum reperit, stagnat insulasque molitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:9:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trabes in solo collocantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super pilas lapide quadrato solum stratum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:33" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecta (porticus) solo jungens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:430" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 430</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solo aequata omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 47 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clivus Publicius ad solum exustus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:26:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 26, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem ad solum diruere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:10:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 10, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 4, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solo exaequare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:13:4" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solo aequare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:4:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedificia cuncta solo cohaerentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ISIDI TEMPLVM A SOLO POSVIT,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 457</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 467</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> 10, 47</bibl>: domo pignori data et area ejus tenebitur: est enim pars ejus; <cit><quote lang="la">et contra jus soli sequitur aedificium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:7:21" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 13, 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum proscindere terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1295" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1295</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 212</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:211" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 211</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1289" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1289</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: recente terrae <pb n="1724" /> <cb n="SOLU" /> sola sanguine maculans, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sola dura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 63, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:3" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:1:56" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 1, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:445" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 4, 445</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi praeter agri solum nihil esse reliqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum exile et macrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:25:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 25, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incultum et derelictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:4:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">densum, siccum, macrum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:5 sq" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 5 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duratae solo nives,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">putre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 204</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foecundum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:417" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 417</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulvereum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:113" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:789" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 789</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:420" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 420</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pingue,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praepingue,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:698" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 698</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exiguum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:22" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:4:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 4, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:5:17" default="NO">7, 5, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viride,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">presso exercere solum sub vomere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 356</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solo inmobilis haeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 250</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingreditur solo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solo recubans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 392</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reptans solo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:5:83" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 5, 83</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saturare fimo pingui sola,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardent sola terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:592" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 592</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:40" default="NO" valid="yes">61, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:3" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:1:56" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 1, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:445" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 4, 445</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 5, 13</bibl>, B. 1. infra: solum hominis exitium herbae, <hi rend="ital">the sole</hi> of the foot, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:47" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 47 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi calciamentum solorum (est) callum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:32:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 32, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca nullius ante Trita solo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:927" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 927</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(canes) unguibus duris, solo nec ut corneo nec nimium duro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:9:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: qui auro soccis habeat suppactum solum, <hi rend="ital">the sole</hi> of a shoe, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 98</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of a dog: solum corneum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:9:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cereale solum pomis agrestibus augent,</quote> <trans><tr>their wheaten board</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vastis tremit ictibus aerea puppis, Subtrahiturque solum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the sea under the vessel</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne ponti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:712" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 712</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">astra tenent caeleste solum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the vault of heaven</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 73</bibl></cit>: manibusque cruentis Pulsat inane solum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the sockets</hi> of the eyes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:55" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 55</bibl>.— Prov.: quodcumque or quod in solum venit, <hi rend="ital">whatever falls to the ground</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">whatever comes uppermost</hi> or <hi rend="ital">occurs to the mind</hi>, = quod in buccam venit, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 500, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:23:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 23, 65</bibl>; Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 124, 18 sq.</bibl> (Com. Fragm. v. 41 Rib.).—Also ellipt. (cf. bucca): <cit><quote lang="la">convivio delector: ibi loquor, quod in solum ut dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 26, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44683.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen. </sense><sense id="n44683.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Soil</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">land</hi>, <hi rend="ital">country</hi>, <hi rend="ital">region</hi>, <hi rend="ital">place</hi> (cf.: terra, tellus, humus): sola terrarum, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=301" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 301</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 443 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">solum, in quo tu ortus et procreatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">patriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 7, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro solo, in quo nati essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 30, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natale,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>native country</tr>, <tr>natal soil</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 184</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:3:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 3, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 334" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 334</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in gremio regni solique genitalis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 12, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Miletus, genitale solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:7:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 7, 5</bibl></cit> (7);
