<bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 3, 2</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos, mutae regiones, imploro, et sola terrarum ultimarum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sola Romana,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Max. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vile solum Sparte est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:428" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 428</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romani numen utrumque soli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:292" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 292</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maxima Fundani gloria soli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:11:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 2, 11, 28</bibl></cit>.— Hence, solum vertere, <hi rend="ital">to leave one's country</hi> (generally said of going into exile): <cit><quote lang="la">qui volunt poenam aliquam subterfugere, eo solum vertunt, hoc est, sedem ac locum mutant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:34:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 34, 100</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">neque exsilii causā solum vertisse diceretur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 28, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 5, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes">43, 2 al.</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">solum civitatis mutatione vertere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 11, 28</bibl></cit>.—Rarely, in this sense: <cit><quote lang="la">solum mutare: exsules sunt, etiam si solum non mutarint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:4:2:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 4, 2, 31</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quo vertendi, hoc est mutandi, soli causā venerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:30:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 30, 78</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44683.4" n="2" level="3"> In jurid. lang.: res soli, <hi rend="ital">land</hi>, and all that stands upon it, <hi rend="ital">real estate</hi> (opp. res mobiles, personal or movable property): <cit><quote lang="la">omnes res, sive mobiles sint, sive soli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:3:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 13, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">res soli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:16:1:section=32" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 43, 16, 1, § 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tertia pars de agris, terris, arbustis, satis quaerit, et, ut jurisconsultorum verbo utar, de omnibus quae solo continentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:1:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 19, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut feneratores duas patrimonii partes in solo collocarent,</quote> <trans><tr>lay out in land</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in solo proprio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Flor. 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44683.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a base</hi>, <hi rend="ital">basis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foundation</hi> (very rare): auspicio regni stabilita scamna solumque, i. e. <hi rend="ital">throne</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 48 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> (Ann. v. 99 Vahl.); cf.: Tarquinio dedit imperium simul et sola regni, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=298" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 298</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 151 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">solum quidem et quasi fundamentum oratoris vides locutionem emendatam et Latinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:74:258" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 74, 258</bibl></cit>: solum quoddam atque fundamentum,<cb n="SOLU" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:37:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 37, 151</bibl>: solo aequandae sunt dictaturae consulatusque, <hi rend="ital">to be levelled with the ground</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be utterly abolished</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:18:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 18, 14</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ad solum dirutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,042:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Nah. 2, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n44684" type="main" key="so_lum2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōlum</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. solus <sense id="n44684.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
solummodo: <entryFree id="n44685" type="main" key="so_lummo^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōlummŏdo</orth>, v. 1. <itype>solus</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>, A. 2.</entryFree>
soluntinus: <entryFree id="n44686" type="main" key="So^lunti_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŏluntīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 2. Solus.</entryFree>
solus: <entryFree id="n44687" type="main" key="so_lus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (<sense id="n44687.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> regular. solius; <case>dat.</case> soli; <hi rend="ital">gen. m.</hi> soli, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 694</bibl> P.; <hi rend="ital">dat. m.</hi> SOLO, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2627</bibl>; <gen>f.</gen> solae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 6, 3</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>orig. the same with sollus, q. v.; cf. salus. By Pott referred to sui, Kühn. Zeitschr. 5, 242</etym>. </sense><sense id="n44687.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44687.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">alone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">only</hi>, <hi rend="ital">single</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sole</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">unus, unicus, singularis): quod egomet solus feci, nec quisquam alius affuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 269</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum omnibus potius quam soli perire voluerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum visum esset utilius solum quam cum altero regnare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:10:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 10, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">licebit eum solus ames,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot mea Solius solliciti sint causa, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec mihi soli versantur ante oculos ... sed, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:27:102" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 27, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sibi se soli natum meminerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:14:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 14, 45 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extra Peloponnesum Aenianes, etc. ... soli absunt a mari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:4:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae sola divina sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:27:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 27, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita sola errare videbar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:1:45" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Ann. 1, 45</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Africanum solitum esse dicere, se numquam minus solum esse, quam cum solus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 17, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem narrabit sola soli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 2, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 1, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 31</bibl>; Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 694</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">de viginti Restabam solus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:688" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 688</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solus ex plurimis servis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solus ex toto illo collegio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Stoici soli ex omnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:18:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 18, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu ex omnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 17, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego meorum solus sum meus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coturnices solae animalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 23, 33, § 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solus inter omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:2:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (actio) sola per se ipsa quanta sit, histrionum ars declarat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 5, 18</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">per se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:15:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 15, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 1 al.</bibl>—With <hi rend="ital">subj. inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam solum habere velle summa dementia est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:26:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 26, 56</bibl></cit>.—Strengthened by <hi rend="ital">unus: Ch.</hi> Quid, duasne is uxores habet? <hi rend="ital">So.</hi> Obsecro: <cit><quote lang="la">unam ille quidem hanc solam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum unum hoc vitium affert senectus hominibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furta praetoris quae essent HS. duodecies, ex uno oppido solo exportata sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:75:section=185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 75, § 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unam solam scitote esse civitatem, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">13: te unum solum suum depeculatorem venisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:40:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 40, 96</bibl></cit>.—With other numerals (freq. and class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 51</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 45, 138</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 8, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:74:section=182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 74, § 182</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Ge.</hi> Quantum tibi opus est argenti? <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Solae triginta minae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 3, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui solos novem menses Asiae praefuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 17, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:55:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 55, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:36:8" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 36, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:23:10" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 23, 10</bibl>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:97" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 97</bibl>. —In <hi rend="ital">voc.</hi>: felix lectule talibus sole amoribus, Attic. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 673</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n44687.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">alone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lonely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solitary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forsaken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deserted;</hi> without relatives, friends, etc. (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. solitarius): sola sum: habeo hic neminem, Neque amicum neque cognatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 67</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 2, 3, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solus atque omnium honestarum rerum egens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 3:61:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 61, 3</bibl> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudet me vacuo solam tabescere lecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:5" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 5</bibl></cit> (4, 6), 23.—</sense><sense id="n44687.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of places, <hi rend="ital">lonely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solitary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfrequented</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desert</hi>, = desertus (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">hic solis locis composita sum, Hic saxa sunt, hic mare sonat, nec quisquam Homo mihi obviam venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 3, 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in locis solis moestus errares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:28:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 28, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:396" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 396</bibl></cit>; Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 8, 6</bibl> (for which shortly before: loca deserta); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 103:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 103, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 6, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 4, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 4, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 4, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7</bibl> (8), 86: <cit><quote lang="la">Libyae agri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 249</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 184</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in harena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 64, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solā sub rupe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 154</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in monte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:72" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 72</bibl></cit> (Müll. solito) et saep.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sōlum</orth>, <hi rend="ital">alone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">only</hi>, <hi rend="ital">merely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">barely.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44687.5" n="A" level="2"> Affirmatively (rare but class.; syn. tantum, but never with numerals, except unus; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">solus, A. supra): de re unā solum dissident, de ceteris mirifice congruunt. Ain' tandem? unā de re solum est dissensio?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:20:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 20, 53</bibl></cit>: nos nuntiationem<cb n="SOLV" />  solum habemus: <cit><quote lang="la">consules etiam spectionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:32:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 32, 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:48:160" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 48, 160</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi vero atrā bili solum mens ac non saepe vel iracundia graviore vel timore moveatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:5:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae hominum solum auribus judicantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:58:146" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 58, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi vero perpetua oratio rhetorum solum, non etiam philosophorum sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:6:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 6, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44687.6" n="2" level="3"> Strengthened by <hi rend="ital">modo</hi>, and joined with it in one word, <orth extent="full" lang="la">sōlummŏdo</orth> (only late Lat., for the true reading, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 92</bibl>, is unam tantum, Jan. Detlef.; <cit><quote lang="la">whereas tantummodo is class.): de exercitore solummodo Praetor sentit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:9:1:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 9, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pretii solummodo fieri aestimationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:23:section=1" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 9, 2, 23, § 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:5:1:section=3" default="NO">11, 5, 1, § 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:5:1:section=1" default="NO">28, 5, 1, § 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 247" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 247</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44687.7" n="B" level="2"> Negatively: non solum, nec (neque) solum ... sed (verum) etiam (et), etc., <hi rend="ital">not only</hi> (<hi rend="ital">not merely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not barely</hi>) ... <hi rend="ital">but also</hi>, etc. (class. and freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">non solum publicas, sed etiam privatas injurias ultus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes non solum multis periculis oppositae, sed etiam caecis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">importantur non merces solum adventiciae, sed etiam mores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque solum fictum, sed etiam imperite absurdeque fictum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 15, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te non solum naturā et moribus, verum etiam studio et doctrinā esse sapientem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non nobis solum nati sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:7:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sapiens solum contentus possit vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:13:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 13, 44</bibl></cit> Madv. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">bestiae sibi solum natae sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 19, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero solum hanc libidinem laudant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:19:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 19, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servavit ab omni Non solum facto verum opprobrio quoque turpi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non enim jus illud solum superbius populo, sed violentius videri necesse erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:7:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 7, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 10, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non solum ortum novum populum, sed adultum jam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:11:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 11, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus opibus ac nervis non solum ad minuendam gratiam, sed paene ad perniciem suam uteretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae non solum facta esse, sed ne fieri quidem potuisse cernimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:15:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 15, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene meriti de rebus communibus, ut genere etiam putarentur non solum ingenio esse divino,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque solum civis, set cujusmodi genus hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 39:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 39, 6</bibl></cit>; v. non and sed.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n44688" type="main" key="So^lu_s2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŏlūs</orth>, <itype>untis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*solou=s</foreign>, <sense id="n44688.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town on the northern coast of Sicily</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Castello di Solanto</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 90</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŏ-luntīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Solus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:43:section=103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 43, § 103</bibl>; <number>sing.</number>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 42</bibl>, § 102.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n44689" type="main" key="so^lus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏlus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. solum <sense id="n44689.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
solute: <entryFree id="n44690" type="main" key="so^lu_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏlūtē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. solvo, <sense id="n44690.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
solutilis: <entryFree id="n44691" type="hapax" key="so^lu_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏlūtĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>solvo</etym>, <sense id="n44691.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is easily loosed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">taken apart</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">navis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
solutim: <entryFree id="n44692" type="hapax" key="so^lu_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏlūtim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n44692.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">loosely</hi>, = solute, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
solutio: <entryFree id="n44693" type="main" key="so^lu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏlūtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n44693.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a loosing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unloosing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissolution</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n44693.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44693.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">linguae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:25:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 25, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totius hominis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:25:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 25, 61</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventris et stomachi solutiones,</quote> <trans><tr>looseness</tr>, <tr>weakness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 6, 60, § 112</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">stomachi solutio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44693.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">payment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">solutio rerum creditarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:24:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 24, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:12:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 12, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justi crediti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nummorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:3:54" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 46, 3, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romae solutione impeditā fides concidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solutionem in procuratorem factam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:8:12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 46, 8, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nominis Caerelliani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:51:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 51, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">explicatā solutione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 20, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 20</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 46</bibl>, tit. 3: De solutionibus et liberationibus.—</sense><sense id="n44693.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a solution</hi>, <hi rend="ital">explanation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non est quod expectes, ut solutionem tibi ostendam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:34:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 34, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumentorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 2:34:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 34, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Dan. 4, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:12:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 12, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">captionis sophisticae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:2:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 2, 6</bibl></cit> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">sophismatis resolutio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:2:6:section=10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 18, 2, 6, § 10</bibl></cit>).</sense></entryFree>
solutor: <entryFree id="n44694" type="main" key="so^lu_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏlūtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym> (post-class.). <sense id="n44694.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A looser</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an opener</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">signaculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Mor. Manich. 2:13" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Mor. Manich. 2, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n44694.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A payer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
solutrix: <entryFree id="n44695" type="hapax" key="so^lu_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏlūtrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>solutor</etym>, <sense id="n44695.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that looses</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sets free</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">malorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 484</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
solutus: <entryFree id="n44696" type="main" key="so^lu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏlūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of solvo.</entryFree>
solva: <entryFree id="n44697" type="main" key="Solva"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Solva</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n44697.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Noricum</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 537, 1</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Solvensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Solva</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Flavium Solvense (sc. oppidum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 24, 27, § 146</bibl></cit>. <pb n="1725" /> <cb n="SOLV" /></sense></entryFree>
solvo: <entryFree id="n44698" type="main" key="solvo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">solvo</orth>, <itype>solvi, solūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (<sense id="n44698.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> soluit, trisyll., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 2, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">soluisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:5:16" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 5, 16</bibl></cit>) [for se-luo; cf. socors for se-cords], <hi rend="ital">to loosen an object</hi> from any thing, <hi rend="ital">to release</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to loose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi> any thing which binds or restrains another. </sense><sense id="n44698.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To loose</hi> an object bound, <hi rend="ital">to release</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set free</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disengage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissolve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take apart.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44698.2" n="A" level="2"> In a corporeal sense. </sense><sense id="n44698.3" n="1" level="3"> Outwardly, <hi rend="ital">to release.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44698.4" n="a" level="4"> From fetters or custody, <hi rend="ital">to free</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set free</hi>, <hi rend="ital">release; absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvite istas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>from fetters</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvite istum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:5:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 5, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam, nisi me orassis, solves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 5, 2, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jube solvi (eum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 4, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad palum adligati repente soluti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:5:section=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 5, § 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vincti solvantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 6</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">12: qui in compedibus corporis semper fuerunt, etiam cum soluti sunt, tardius ingrediuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:31:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 31, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita nexi soluti (sunt),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:28:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 28, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvite me, pueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fore ut brevi solveretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 12</bibl>.—With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">canis solutus catenā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 7, 20</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, from the fetter of frost: <cit><quote lang="la">solutis amnibus (i. e. frigoris vinculo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:15" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae quem (florem) ferunt solutae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 4, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.5" n="b" level="4"> From reins, ties, bands, etc.: solve senescentem equum, <hi rend="ital">from the rein</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">dismiss him from service</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solverat sol equos,</quote> <trans><tr>unhitched</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:407" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 407</bibl></cit>: currum solvere (i. e. ab equis, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for equos a curru), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 794" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 794</bibl>: solvere epistulam, i. e. <hi rend="ital">from the string by which it was tied</hi> (= <hi rend="ital">to open</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 11, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et tibi sollicitā solvitur illa (epistula) manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:2:2" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et jacet in gremio charta soluta meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecepit suis ne sarcinas solverent, aut onera deponerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:5:3" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.—So of garments and sails, <hi rend="ital">to unfurl</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfold</hi>: cum tunicā solutā inambularet, Asin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:32:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 32, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 4:1:26" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 4, 1, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solutā togā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:147" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vela solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:574" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 574</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n44698.6" n="c" level="4"> From any fastening (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug. prose), <hi rend="ital">to detach</hi> from; constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, or with <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> or <hi rend="ital">de</hi>, and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caucasiā solvet de rupe Promethei bracchia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:69" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraxinus solvitur,</quote> <trans><tr>from the ground</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:498" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 498</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceciditque soluta pinus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 409</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pinus radice solutā, deficit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:152" default="NO"><author>id.</author> S. 5, 1, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solutis radicibus arbusta procumbunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:27:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 27, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accepi epistulam quam, ut scribis, ancorā solutā de phaselo dedisti, i. e. a litore,</quote> <trans><tr>detached</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 13, 1</bibl></cit> B. and K. (al. sublatā; <cit><quote lang="la">but soluta is perh. an error of Cic. in the use of a technical term, v Orell. ad loc.).—In the same sense: solvere retinacula classis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:696" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 696</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 102</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">querno solvunt de stipite funem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:333" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 333</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fune soluto Currit in immensum carina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:11:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 11, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curvo solves viscera cultro (i. e. de corpore ferarum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 53" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 53</bibl></cit>.—Of rain disengaged from the clouds: <cit><quote lang="la">imber caelesti nube solutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 237</bibl></cit>: (Lunam) imperfectā vi solvere tantum umorem, <hi rend="ital">disengage only the moisture</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">from the earth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum solis radii absumant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 9, 6, § 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solutum a latere pugionem,</quote> <trans><tr>detached from his side</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.7" n="d" level="4"> Esp., of ships: navem solvere, <hi rend="ital">to free a ship from the land</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to set sail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weigh anchor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leave land</hi>, <hi rend="ital">depart.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44698.8" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> alone: <cit><quote lang="la">eisce confectis navem solvimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:1:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 1, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navim cupimus solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves solvit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 26</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 102: primis tenebris solvit navem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postero die solvere naves (jussi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 8, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">classem solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:7" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 7</bibl> (4, 6), 23.—</sense><sense id="n44698.9" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">navis a terrā solverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinto inde die quam ab Corintho solverit naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 7 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvunt a litore puppes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:649" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 649</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.10" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ex</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam noctu hac soluta est navis nostra e portu Persico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 259</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interea e portu nostra navis solvitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.11" n="(d)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">complures mercatores Alexandriā solvisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:12:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 12, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portu solventibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 2, 4</bibl></cit>.— (<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (sc. navem or naves): <cit><quote lang="la">tertiā fere vigiliā solvit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos eo die cenati solvimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altero die quam a Brundusio solvit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 14 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui inde solverant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:7:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvi mare languido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 53:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 53, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortasse etiam ventis minantibus solves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:35:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 2, 35, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non eadem est his et illis causa solvendi,</quote> <trans><tr>making sea-voyages</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. N. 5, 18</bibl></cit>, <cb n="SOLV" /> 16.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With navis, etc., as <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to leave the land</hi> (sc. se a litore): <cit><quote lang="la">naves XVIII. ex superiore portu solverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 28</bibl></cit>; and by another change of construction: solvimus oram, <hi rend="ital">we freed the shore</hi>, i.e. from the ship, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Ep. ad Tryph. 3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. ad Tryph. 3</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> usages: <cit><quote lang="la">de litore puppis solvit iter,</quote> <trans><tr>clears the voyage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:243" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 1, 243</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tibi Tyrrhenā solvatur funis harenā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:8:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 8, 11</bibl></cit> (cf.: retinacula solvere, c. supra).—</sense><sense id="n44698.12" n="e" level="4"> Of secretions from the body (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">tempore eo quo menstrua solvit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:706" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 706</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruor solvitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:530" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 530</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimas solvere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Achill. 2, 256</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solutis lacrimis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Ruf. 2, 258</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">partūs solvere,</quote> <trans><tr>to bear</tr>, <tr>bring forth</tr>, <tr>be delivered of offspring</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:258" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 258</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:461" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 461</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 3, 6, § 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:6" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 1, 1, § 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.13" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To loosen</hi> an object from that which holds it together, <hi rend="ital">to break up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissolve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disperse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take apart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scatter.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44698.14" n="a" level="4"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">omne colligatum solvi potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:chapter=11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.15" n="b" level="4"> Of structures (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">solvere naves et rursus conjungere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:10:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvere quassatae parcite membra ratis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dubitavit an solveret pontem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:16:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 16, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvere pontem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si pons solutus sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:11:2:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 11, 2, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solutus pons tempestatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:13:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 13, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">currum (solis) solutum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 1, 740</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.16" n="c" level="4"> Of woven stuff: <cit><quote lang="la">solvens texta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:9:6" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 9, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.17" n="d" level="4"> Of mountains: <cit><quote lang="la">utrimque montes solvit (Hercules),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 237" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tridente Neptunus montem solvit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 553" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Agam. 553</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.18" n="e" level="4"> Of the neck: <cit><quote lang="la">soluta cervix silicis impulsu,</quote> <trans><tr>broken</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 1119" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 1119</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.19" n="f" level="4"> Of a comet: <cit><quote lang="la">momentum quo cometes solutus et in duas partes redactus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:16:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 7, 16, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.20" n="g" level="4"> Of the hair, <hi rend="ital">to loosen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">untie</hi>, <hi rend="ital">let fall</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">solve capillos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:784" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 784</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:682" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 11, 682</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 584</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:15" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 15</bibl> (3, 7), 46: <cit><quote lang="la">comas casside,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:2" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:854" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 854</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n44698.21" n="h" level="4"> Of the earth (so mostly <pos>P. a.</pos>, q. <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>; <cit><quote lang="la">post-Aug.): ita in terrae corpore evenit ut partes ejus vetustate solvantur, solutae cadant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:10:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi montis latus nova ventis solvit hiems,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:745" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 745</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n44698.22" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To dissolve; pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be dissolved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">changed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pass over into</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and postclass. for dissolvere, or transire in); constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, or with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>acc.</case> </sense><sense id="n44698.23" n="(a)" level="5"> Of a change into air or gas: <cit><quote lang="la">calor mobiliter solvens, differt primordia vini,</quote> <trans><tr>dissolving</tr>, <tr>parts the molecules of the wine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 235</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam materiai copia ferretur per inane soluta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1018" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 1018</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 1103</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita fatus in aëra rursus solvitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:285" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 285</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">nec in aëra solvi Passa, recentem animam caelestibus intulit astris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:845" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 845</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.24" n="(b)" level="5"> Into a liquid, <hi rend="ital">to melt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe terra in tabem solvitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:15:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 15, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram quam diximus esse mutabilem et solvi in umorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 3:29:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 29, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum tellus se solvit in amnem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:408" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 408</bibl></cit>; ipsum in conubia terrae Aethera, cum pluviis rarescunt nubila, solvo, <hi rend="ital">dissolve into the embrace of the earth</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">change into rain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:186" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 186</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex Aethiopiae jugis solutas nives ad Nilum decurrere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:2:17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 2, 17</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">nivem solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 4:5:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:6:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 6, 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 729" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 729</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rigor auri solvitur aestu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:493" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 493</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum calidi solvant camini,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 250</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerae igne solutae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Iris cum vino triduo non solvitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 20, 83, § 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(herba) quinto die solvitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 14, 88, § 148</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.25" n="(g)" level="5"> Of putrefaction: <cit><quote lang="la">(vitulo) per integram solvuntur viscera pellem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:302" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 302</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.26" n="(d)" level="5"> Of change in general: <cit><quote lang="la">inque novas abiit massa soluta domos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:108" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repentino crementur incendio, atque ex tantā varietate solvantur atque eant in unum omnia (sc. all the heavenly bodies),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:22" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 22</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) Of expansion by heat: <cit><quote lang="la">(uva) cum modo frigoribus premitur, modo solvitur aestu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 317</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) Hence, solvere, <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rarefy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravitas aëris solvitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:5:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) Solvi in, <hi rend="ital">to pass into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">become</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in cacumine (herbae) capitula purpurea quae solvantur in lanugines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 8, 39, § 61</bibl></cit>.—Of a wave: <cit><quote lang="la">donec in planitiem immotarum aquarum solvatur,</quote> <trans><tr>disappears in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postremi (equi) solvuntur in aequora pisces (= solvuntur in pisces),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:47" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 47</bibl></cit>: lumina in lacrimas solventur, <hi rend="ital">stream with tears.</hi> —Hence, solvere, causative, <hi rend="ital">to make pass over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make vanish in</hi>: circulum in pulverem, in quo descriptus est, solvere, Sen. <cb n="SOLV" /> Ep. 74, 27: soluti agri, <hi rend="ital">the boundaries of which are effaced</hi>, Sic. Fl. Cond. Agr. p. 3 Goes.—</sense><sense id="n44698.27" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To consume</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to destroy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissolve</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvere orbes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 1, 497</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ni calor et ventus ... interemant sensum diductaque solvant (i.e. sensum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 287</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Cato) ferrei prope corporis animique, quem ne senectus quidem, quae solvit omnia, fregerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:40:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 40, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si (cometae) sunt purus ignis ... nec illos conversio mundi solvit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:2:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 7, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(turbo) ab eo motu, qui universum trahit, solveretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 7:9:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabes solvit corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:809" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 809</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec solum silvas, sed saxa ingentia solvit (ignis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:506" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 506</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne tegat functos humus, ne solvat ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 750" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 750</bibl></cit>.—So, vitam solvere, <hi rend="ital">to extinguish life</hi>, esp. of gradual or easy death: <cit><quote lang="la">solvas potius (vitam), quam abrumpas, dummodo, si alia solvendi ratio non erit, vel abrumpas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 22:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 22, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc mihi solvite vitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:9:39" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 9, 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.28" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44698.29" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To free</hi>, <hi rend="ital">release</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">emancipate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set free;</hi> constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, with <case>abl.</case> or <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> and <case>abl.</case>; rarely with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44698.30" n="a" level="4"> From the body, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">teque isto corpore solvo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:703" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 703</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solutā corpore animā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui solutas vinculis animas recipit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. 28:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. 28, 8</bibl></cit>: si animus somno relaxatus solute (i. e. <hi rend="ital">free from the shackles of the body</hi>) moveatur ac libere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:48:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 48, 100</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem solvere,</quote> <trans><tr>to set free the voice</tr>, <tr>to speak</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:1" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 682" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 682</bibl>; so, responsa solve (pregn. = <hi rend="ital">utter and disclose</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 292" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 292</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspiria solvit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:604" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 604</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvat turba jocos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 114" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solutos Qui captat risus hominum (= quem juvat risus hominum solvere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ausonii ... versibus incomptis ludunt risuque soluto,</quote> <trans><tr>unrestrained</tr>, <tr>free</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:386" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 386</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.31" n="b" level="4"> Of members or parts of the body: linguam solvere, <hi rend="ital">to unfetter the tongue</hi> (sc. vinculis oris), <hi rend="ital">to give flow to words</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguam (Juno) ad jurgia solvit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 261</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua devincta nec in motus varios soluta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:3:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quisque contemptissimus est, ita linguae solutissimae est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. 11:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Const. 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(fama) innumeras solvit in praeconia linguas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:472" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 472</bibl></cit>. —Solvere bracchia, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to unfetter the arms</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to move them</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna difficili solventem bracchia motu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 604</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of the free motions of animals: columbae soluto volatu multum velociores,</quote> <trans><tr>unrestrained flight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 36, 52, § 108</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.32" n="c" level="4"> From obligations and debts: <cit><quote lang="la">solvit me debito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:4:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an nos debito solverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 81:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 81, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut religione civitas solvatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:34:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 34, 98</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 3, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">te decem tauri ... Me tener solvet vitulus (sc. religione),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 54</bibl></cit>.—So from a military oath: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc si impetro, solvo vos jurejurando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:4:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 14, 4, 7</bibl></cit>.—Sacramento or militiā solvere, <hi rend="ital">to dismiss a soldier from service</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacramento solvi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum quis propter delictum sacramento solvitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:16:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 16, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militiā solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 44</bibl></cit>.— Munere (publico) solvere, <hi rend="ital">to exempt from public duties</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Ilienses publico munere solverentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 58</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">obj. inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut manere solveretur,</quote> <trans><tr>that he should be excused from the duty of remaining</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.33" n="d" level="4"> From guilt and sin, <hi rend="ital">to acquit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">absolve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cleanse</hi> (cf. absolvere, to acquit of crime): <cit><quote lang="la">si ille huic (insidias fecerit), ut scelere solvamur,</quote> <trans><tr>be held guiltless</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:12:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 12, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque hunc ille summus vir scelere solutum periculo liberavit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sit capitis damno Roma soluta mei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:452" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 452</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsum quoque Pelea Phoci Caede per Haemonias solvit Acastus aquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Helenen ego crimine solvo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:371" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 371</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid crimine solvis Germanum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:379" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 379</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solutam caede Gradivus manum restituit armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 1342" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 1342</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n44698.34" n="e" level="4"> From feelings, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae eos qui quaesissent curā et negotio solverent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:18:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 18, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ego vos solvi curis ceteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus curā belli solutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 3, 4, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus linquunt curā solutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his terroribus ab Epicuro soluti et in libertatem vindicati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:20:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 20, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soluti metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 14 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:51" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvent formidine terras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solve metu patriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 6, 41: <cit><quote lang="la">metu belli Scythas solvit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 9, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec est Vita solutorum miserā ambitione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soluti a cupiditatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his concitationibus quem vacuum, solutum, liberum videris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:15:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 15, 43</bibl></cit>: et tu solve me dementiā,<pb n="1726" /> <cb n="SOLV" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:43" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">longo luctu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristem juventam solve (i. e. juventam tristitiā),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 450" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 450</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvite tantis animum monstris, solvite, superi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 1063" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Herc. Fur. 1063</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quis te solvere Thessalis Magus venenis poterit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:27:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 27, 21</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvit animis miracula (for animos miraculis),</quote> <trans><tr>the soul from superstition</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 1, 103</bibl></cit>.—And of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">rabie tigrim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 707</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ad praecepta quae damus possit ire animus, solvendus est (i. e. perturbationibus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:38" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calices, quem non fecere contractā in paupertate solutum?</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>from cares</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvite animos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 12</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix haec in munera solvo animum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>free it from passions and so make it fit for these duties</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:33" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.35" n="f" level="4"> From sleep, very rare: <cit><quote lang="la">ego somno solutus sum,</quote> <trans><tr>awoke</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:26:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 26, 29</bibl></cit> (cf.: somno solvi, <hi rend="ital">to be overwhelmed by sleep</hi>, 2. <foreign lang="greek">b, g</foreign> infra).—</sense><sense id="n44698.36" n="g" level="4"> From labor, business, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">volucres videmus ... solutas opere volitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:6:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 2, 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solutus onere regio, regni bonis fruor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 685" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 685</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romulus excubias decrevit in otia solvi,</quote> <trans><tr>to be relieved from guard and enjoy leisure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 4, 79.—</sense><sense id="n44698.37" n="h" level="4"> From rigidity, austerity, stiffness, etc., <hi rend="ital">to relax</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smooth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unbend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soothe</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">frontem solvere disce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:183" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltem ora trucesque solve genas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:373" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 373</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvit feros tunc ipse rictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 797" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 797</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvatur fronte senectus = frons senectute (i. e. rugis), solvatur,</quote> <trans><tr>be cleared</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:13:5" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 13, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultum risu solvit,</quote> <trans><tr>relieves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:3:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">risum judicis movendo, et illos tristes affectus solvit, et animum renovat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">solvere judicem,</quote> <trans><tr>unbend</tr>, <tr>excite his laughter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvere qui (potui) Curios Fabriciosque graves (sc. risu),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:28" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 28</bibl></cit> (29), 4: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tamen arctum Solveret hospitiis animum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus non contractum sollicitudine animum illius argutiae solvant?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. Helv. 18:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. Helv. 18, 5</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, pregn.: <cit><quote lang="la">solventur risu tabulae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the austerity of the judge will be relaxed by laughter</tr>, <tr>and the complaint dismissed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 86</bibl></cit>.—Imitated: <cit><quote lang="la">quia si aliquid omiserimus, cum risu quoque tota res solvitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:67" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 67</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.38" n="k" level="4"> From any cause of restraint. </sense><sense id="n44698.39" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To release from siege</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bassanitas obsidione solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriam obsidione solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 2, 2</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n44698.40" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">From moral restraints</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic palam cupiditates suas solvit,</quote> <trans><tr>gave vent to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:6:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; v. also <pos>P. a.</pos>, B. 7. infra.—</sense><sense id="n44698.41" n="l" level="4"> From laws and rules: legibus solvere. </sense><sense id="n44698.42" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To exempt from laws</hi>, i. e. by privilege: <cit><quote lang="la">Vopiscus, qui ex aedilitate consulatum petit, solvatur legibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur M. Brutus legibus est solutus, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 13, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut interea magistratus reliquos, legibus omnibus soluti, petere possetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:36:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 36, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lurco, tribunus plebis, solutus est (et lege Aeliā et Furiā),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 16, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvatne legibus Scipionem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petente Flacco ut legibus solverentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:50:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 50, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scipio legibus solutus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Epit. 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Licet enim, inquiunt, legibus soluti sumus, attamen legibus vivimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 2:17:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 2, 17, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut munere vigintiviratūs solveretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 29</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the laws of nature, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">(aestus) illo tempore, solutus legibus, sine modo fertur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:28:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 28, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solus (sapiens) generis humani legibus solvitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 15:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brev.
