Vit. 15, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec leti lege solutas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:687" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 687</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec solvo Rutulos (i. e. legibus fati),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 111</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (cf. libero), perh. only in phrase testamenti solvere, <hi rend="ital">to release from a testamentary disposition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et is per aes et libram heredes testamenti solveret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:20:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 20, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 21, 53</bibl> (less prop. testamenti is taken as attribute of heredes); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:175" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 175</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:17:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 17, 16</bibl>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, B. 5. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> infra.— </sense><sense id="n44698.43" n="(b)" level="5"> Legibus solutus, <hi rend="ital">not subject to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">released from</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reus Postumus est eā lege ... solutus ac liber,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the law does not apply to him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soluti (lege Juliā) huc convenistis, ne constricti discedatis cavete,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 18</bibl></cit>.—Of other laws: <cit><quote lang="la">solutus Legibus insanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae sedes expectent animam solutam legibus servitutis humanae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 65:20" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 65, 20</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things: soluta legibus scelera sunt, <hi rend="ital">unrestrained by the laws</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">crimes are committed with impunity</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:27:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 27, 1</bibl>.— Of the laws of versification: numerisque fertur Lege solutis, referring to dithyrambic<cb n="SOLV" />  measures, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 12</bibl> (cf. <pos>P. a.</pos>, B. 11. infra).—</sense><sense id="n44698.44" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To dissolve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separate</hi> objects which are united, <hi rend="ital">to break up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dismiss.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44698.45" n="(a)" level="5"> Of troops, ranks, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi ordines procursando solvissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:65:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 65, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incomposito agmine, solutis ordinibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:1:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:4:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 4, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmina Diductis solvere choris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:581" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 581</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvit maniplos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:154" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvuntur laudata cohors,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 2, 167</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">to separate armies engaged in battle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">commissas acies ego possum solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 4, 59.—</sense><sense id="n44698.46" n="(b)" level="5"> Of banquets, assemblies, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">convivio soluto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivium solvit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:5:24" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 5, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:6:16" default="NO">8, 6, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quid cessas convivia solvere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:675" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 675</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coetuque soluto Discedunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:898" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 898</bibl></cit>.—Hence, urbem (Capuam) solutam ac debilitatam reliquerunt, <hi rend="ital">disfranchised</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:33:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 33, 91</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.47" n="(g)" level="5"> Of the words in discourse, orationem or versum solvere, <hi rend="ital">to break up a sentence</hi> or <hi rend="ital">verse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(discant) versus primo solvere, mox mutatis verbis interpretari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:9:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod cuique visum erit vehementer, dulciter, speciose dictum, solvat ac turbet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut partes orationis sibi soluto versu desideret et pedum proprietates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 8, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non, ut si solvas Postquam discordia tetra, etc., invenias etiam disjecti membra poëtae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 60</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.48" n="3" level="3"> Implying a change for the worse. </sense><sense id="n44698.49" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To relax</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make effeminate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weaken</hi>, by ease, luxury, dissipation, etc. (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">Hannibalem hiberna solverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 51:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 51, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usque eo nimio delicati animi languore solvuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 12:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 12, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infantiam statim deliciis solvimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solutus luxu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 8, 28</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 31</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">soluti in luxum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in lasciviam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 38</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: versum solvere, <hi rend="ital">to deprive a verse of its proper rhythm</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quinque continuos dactylos confundas solveris versum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:49" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.50" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To make torpid by removing sensation.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44698.51" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To relax</hi>, <hi rend="ital">benumb</hi> the limbs or body; <cit><quote lang="la">as by narcotics, terror, sickness, exhaustion: multaque praeterea languentia membra per artus solvunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:798" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 798</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ima Solvuntur latera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:523" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 523</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvi debilitate corporis,</quote> <trans><tr>paralyzed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:7:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut soluto labitur moriens gradu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 368" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 368</bibl></cit>.—In mal. part., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:12:8" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 12, 8</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:523" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 523</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum aget, penna metuente solvi, Fama superstes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>.—Of the mind: <cit><quote lang="la">segnitia (oratoris) solvit animos,</quote> <trans><tr>wearies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:52" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentes solvere,</quote> <trans><tr>to make insane</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 3, 7, § 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.52" n="(b)" level="5"> By frost (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">solvuntur illi frigore membra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:951" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 951</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 92</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.53" n="(g)" level="5"> By sleep (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> for sopio): <cit><quote lang="la">homines volucresque ferasque Solverat alta quies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 186</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora somnus Solverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:369" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 369</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molli languore solutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:648" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 648</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">11, 612: altoque sopore solutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:817" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 817</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somno vinoque solutos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:333" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 333</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 236</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut membra solvit sopor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 867</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non solvit pectora somnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 76" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 76</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvitur in somnos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:530" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 530</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the sea: <cit><quote lang="la">aequor longā ventorum pace solutum,</quote> <trans><tr>lulled to sleep</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:255" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 255</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n44698.54" n="(d)" level="5"> By death: solvi, <hi rend="ital">to die</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">ipse deus, simulatque volam, me solvet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporibus quae senectus solvit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:89:32" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 89, 32</bibl></cit> (cf. A. 4. supra): <cit><quote lang="la">(corpus) quam nullo negotio solvitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:27:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 27, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alius inter cenandum solutus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 66:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 66, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubicumque arietaveris, solveris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. Marc. 11:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cons. Marc. 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me fata maturo exitu facilique solvant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 605" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 605</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvi inediā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic morte quasi somno soluta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:21:11" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 21, 11</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n44698.55" n="4" level="3"> Of logical dissolution, <hi rend="ital">to refute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tradit Epicurus quomodo captiosa solvantur,</quote> <trans><tr>how fallacies are refuted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:7:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumentum solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solutum scies quod nobis opponitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. 12:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. 12, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.56" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To disperse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dispel</hi>, as of a cloud: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum beneficia tempestiva ingentes minas interventu suo solventia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:4:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n44698.57" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To loose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cancel</hi> that which binds any thing. </sense><sense id="n44698.58" n="A" level="2"> In a corporeal sense. </sense><sense id="n44698.59" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to loose</hi> (weaker than rumpo; <cit><quote lang="la">post-Aug.): effringere quam aperire, rumpere quam solvere putant robustius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:12:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā convulsā tota operis colligatio solveretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:14:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 14, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superā compage solutā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:31" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.60" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To remove</hi> a fetter, bridle, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">nullo solvente catenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:700" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 700</bibl></cit>: vincla jugis boum, Tib. <cb n="SOLV" /> 2, 1, 7: <cit><quote lang="la">solvere frenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loris solutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 41</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of prisons: <cit><quote lang="la">qui, solutis ergastulis, exercitus numerum implevit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Ep. 56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Ep. 56</bibl></cit>; Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:10:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 10, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 13, 2</bibl>.—Of frost: <cit><quote lang="la">gelu solvitur,</quote> <trans><tr>it thaws</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvitur acris hiems,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—Of clouds: <cit><quote lang="la">facit igitur ventum resoluta nubes, quae plurimis modis solvitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:12:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 12, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:5:12:1" default="NO">5, 12, 1</bibl>.—Of the grasp of hands, fingers, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Aeacides a corpore bracchia solvit,</quote> <trans><tr>looses his hold</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 246</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indigno non solvit bracchia collo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:217" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 217</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">digitis solutis abjecit jaculum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 585</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.61" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To untie</hi> a string, cord, necklace, etc., <hi rend="ital">slacken</hi> or <hi rend="ital">unlock</hi> an enclosure, <hi rend="ital">open</hi> a box, trunk, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">solve vidulum ergo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam solve cistulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 2, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solve zonam,</quote> <trans><tr>untie</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 5, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvisse jugalem ceston fertur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:62" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animai nodos a corpore solvit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:950" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 950</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil interest quomodo (nodi) solvantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:1:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid boni est, nodos operose solvere, quos ipse ut solveres feceris?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:12:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvere nodum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:646" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 646</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laqueum quem nec solvere possis, nec abrumpere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 10:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix solvi duros a pectore nexus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fasciam solve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 80:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 80, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solutis fasciis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:6:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvi fasciculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crinales vittas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:403" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 403</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Parmenion vinculum epistulae solvens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:2:25" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equum empturus solvi jubes stratum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 80:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 80, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">redimicula solvite collo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:135" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corollas de fronte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:3:21" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvere portas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:492" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 492</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munimina valli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille pharetram Solvit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:380" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 380</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the veins as enclosures of the blood: <cit><quote lang="la">solutis ac patefactis venis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:15:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 15, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venam cultello solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: lychnis alvum solvit,</quote> <trans><tr>looses the bowels</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 26, 98, § 171</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:140" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 20, 83, § 140</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 8, 30, § 74</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (sc. alvum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:29" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stomachus solutus = venter solutus,</quote> <trans><tr>loose bowels</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 117</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 92" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 92</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.62" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to slacken</hi> or <hi rend="ital">remove</hi> a bond. </sense><sense id="n44698.63" n="1" level="3"> Solvere aliquid (aliquod vinculum; cf. I. B. 1. supra). </sense><sense id="n44698.64" n="a" level="4"> Of the mouth, etc., <hi rend="ital">to open</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">talibus ora solvit verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 74</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:181" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 181</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:5:14" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 5, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ternis ululatibus ora Solvit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 191</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 427</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:11:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 11, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 525</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix ora solvi patitur etiamnum timor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 725" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 725</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">os promptius ac solutius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 7</bibl></cit>, ext. 1.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of an abyss: <cit><quote lang="la">hic ora solvit Ditis invisi domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 664" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 664</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.65" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To remove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cancel; to destroy the force of a legal</hi> or <hi rend="ital">moral obligation</hi> by expiration, death, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">si mors alterutrius interveniat, solvitur mandatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:160" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquis renunciaverit societati, societas solvitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:ib. 3:151" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 151</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:ib. 3:152" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 152</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">morte solvetur compromissum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:8:27" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 8, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soluto matrimonio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:3:2" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 24, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solutum conjugium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:79" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ... conjugalia solvit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 144" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec conjugiale solutum Foedus in alitibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:743" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 743</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(sapiens) invitus beneficium per compensationem injuriae solvet,</quote> <trans><tr>cancel the obligation of a favor by the set-off of a wrong</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 81:17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 81, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.66" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To efface</hi> guilt or wrong: <cit><quote lang="la">magnis injuria poenis Solvitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:304" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 304</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solve nefas, dixit: solvit et ille nefas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culpa soluta mea est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:4:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque tu verbis solves unquam quod mi re male feceris (i. e. injuriam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.67" n="d" level="4"> Poenam solvere, <hi rend="ital">to suffer punishment</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to cancel the obligation of suffering</hi>, etc. (cf. 3. infra; <cit><quote lang="la">less freq. than poenam persolvere, exsolvere): serae, sed justae tamen et debitae poenae solutae sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:31:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 31, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capite poenas solvit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 69:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 69, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meritas poenas solventem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:3:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenarum solvendi tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1224</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc solvo poenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Phoen. 172" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Phoen. 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac manu poenas tibi solvam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 1177" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Hippol. 1177</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.68" n="e" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To remove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relieve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soothe</hi> affections, passions, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">atque animi curas e pectore solvat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:908" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 908</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curam metumque juvat Dulci Lyaeo solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:9:38" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 9, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrimonii cura solvatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3</bibl></cit>, praef. § <cit><quote lang="la">2: Pyrrhus impetus sui terrore soluto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:3:14" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvite corde metum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:562" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 562</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 90</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solve metus animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:356" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 356</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvi pericula et metus narrant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 52, § 140</bibl></cit>: neque adhuc Stheneleius iras Solverat Eurystheus,<pb n="1727" /> <cb n="SOLV" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 274</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc uno solvitur ira modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:460" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 460</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvitque pudorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.69" n="f" level="4"> Of sleep: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi clamore solutus Sit sopor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:6:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 6, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec verba, nec herbae audebunt longae somnum tibi solvere Lethes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:768" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 768</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lassitudinem solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 54, § 143</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n44698.70" n="g" level="4"> Of any checks and barriers to motion, <hi rend="ital">to remove.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44698.71" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To raise</hi> a siege: <cit><quote lang="la">solutam cernebat obsidionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 10, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solutā obsidione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:31:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 31, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Locrorum solvendam obsidionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:28:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 28, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 7, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:56" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 56</bibl> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>; 44, 13, 7; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:4:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 9, 2, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.72" n="(b)" level="5"> Of passions, etc., <hi rend="ital">to remove restraint</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus si talis animus est, solvamus nos ejus vincula, et claustra (i. e. irae) refringamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 7, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.73" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To overthrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subvert</hi> a higher authority, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quos (milites), soluto imperio, licentia corruperat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 39:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 39, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperia solvit qui tacet, jussus loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 525" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 525</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonipedes imperia solvunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 1084" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Hippol. 1084</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sanctitas fori ludis solvitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:58" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 58</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.74" n="h" level="4"> Of laws and customs, <hi rend="ital">to abolish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvendarum legum id principium esse censebant (post-Aug. for dissolvendarum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:2:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solutae a se legis monitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 5</bibl></cit>, ext. 4: <cit><quote lang="la">cum plus quam ducentorum annorum morem solveremus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Tarquinius) morem de omnibus senatum consulendi solvit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:49:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 49, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oportebat istum morem solvi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:8:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 8, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.75" n="2" level="3"> Esp. with <case>acc.</case> of the bond, etc. (taking the place of the constr. I. B. 1. 2. 3. supra, when the <hi rend="ital">abl. of separation</hi> is not admissible). </sense><sense id="n44698.76" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To subvert discipline</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplinam militarem solvisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxuria solutam disciplinam militarem esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod cum, ne disciplina solveretur, fecisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:12:2" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 12, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.77" n="b" level="4"> Of strength, energy, attention, etc., <hi rend="ital">to loosen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weaken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scatter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disperse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobilitas factione magis pollebat, plebis vis soluta atque dispersa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 41:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 41, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrios nervos externarum deliciarum contagione solvi et hebetari noluerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:6:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vires solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis illa dicendi solvitur, et frigescit affectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:133" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 133</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.78" n="c" level="4"> Of affection, etc., <hi rend="ital">to sever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissolve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">segnes nodum (amicitiae) solvere Gratiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:21:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 21, 22</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">similarly: solvit (ille deus) amicos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:34" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 34</bibl></cit> (3, 32), 5; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 15</bibl> (3, 7), 26: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc firmos solvit amores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:385" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 385</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amores cantibus et herbis solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:60" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 60</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.79" n="d" level="4"> Of sickness and hunger, <hi rend="ital">to end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitex dicitur febres solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 9, 38, § 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvit jejunia granis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:607" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 607</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam jejunia virgo Solverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:535" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 5, 535</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:282" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 282</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">famem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 64" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 64</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.80" n="e" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To delay</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi classis moras hac morte solvi rentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 1131" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 1131</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n44698.81" n="f" level="4"> Of darkness, <hi rend="ital">to dispel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lux solverat umbras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:390" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 390</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.82" n="g" level="4"> Of war, strife, etc., <hi rend="ital">to compose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">settle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut solve bellum, mater, aut prima excipe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Phoen. 406" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Phoen. 406</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">electus formae certamina solvere pastor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 2, 337</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jurgia solvere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 3, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contradictiones solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:38" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.83" n="h" level="4"> Of difficulties, riddles, questions, ambiguities, etc., <hi rend="ital">to solve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">explain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia quaestionem solvere non posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:12" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 12</bibl></cit>, ext. 3: <cit><quote lang="la">aenigmata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:53" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes solvere posse quaestiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ipsa, quae volvuntur ab illis, solvere malim et expandere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 82:20" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 82, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:14:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. N. 7, 14, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum tantum hoc solvendum est,</quote> <trans><tr>that one question</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 1:7:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puta nunc me istuc non posse solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 48:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 48, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina non intellecta Solverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:760" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 760</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triste carmen alitis solvi ferae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 102" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nodos juris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:50" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proponere aliquid quod solvat quaestionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:96" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plurimas quaestiones illis probationibus solvi solere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 10, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo solvitur quaestio supra tractata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambiguitatem or amphiboliam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 2, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:9:10" default="NO">7, 9, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.84" n="3" level="3"> In partic., of obligations, <hi rend="ital">to fulfil.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44698.85" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To pay.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44698.86" n="(a)" level="5"> Originally, rem solvere, <hi rend="ital">to free one's property and person</hi> (rem familiarem) <hi rend="ital">from debts</hi> (solutio per aes et libram), according to the ancient formula: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ego tibi tot millibus condemnatus sum, me eo nomine ... a te solvo liberoque hoc aere aeneāque librā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:174" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 174</bibl></cit> Huschke; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inde rem creditori palam populo solvit (i. e. per aes et libram),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas res dari, fieri, solvi oportuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 32, 11</bibl></cit>. <cb n="SOLV" /> —Hence, rem solvere, <hi rend="ital">to pay;</hi> often with <hi rend="ital">dat. of person</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro vecturā rem solvit?</quote> <trans><tr>paid the freight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi nugivendis res soluta'st omnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi res soluta est recte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego quidem pro istac rem solvo ab tarpessitā meo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem solvo omnibus quibus dehibeo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 3, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum te strenuas, res erit soluta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res soluta'st, Gripe, ego habeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 5, 3, 57</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: saepe edunt (aves); <cit><quote lang="la">semel si captae sunt, rem solvont aucupi,</quote> <trans><tr>they repay him</tr>, <tr>pay for his expenses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 66</bibl></cit>.—And <hi rend="ital">to pay</hi> by other things than money: <cit><quote lang="la">si tergo res solvonda'st,</quote> <trans><tr>by a whipping</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habent hunc morem ut pugnis rem solvant si quis poscat clarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi quidem copia'st, dum lingua vivet, qui rem solvas omnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 74</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n44698.87" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (sc. rem), <hi rend="ital">to pay;</hi> with or without <hi rend="ital">dat. of person</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus bona, quod populo non solvebat, publice venierunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 18, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ei cum solveret, sumpsit a C. M. Fufiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 20, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">misimus qui pro vecturā solveret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui nimis cito cupit solvere, invitus debet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:40:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 40, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut creditori solvat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:1:49:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 30, 1, 49, § 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si dare vis mihi, Magis solutum erit quam ipsi dederis,</quote> <trans><tr>it will be a more valid payment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam vehementius actum est quam me consule, ne solveretur,</quote> <trans><tr>to stop payments</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:24:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 24, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraudandi spe sublatā solvendi necessitas consecuta est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 24, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum eo ipso quod necesse erat solvi, facultas solvendi impediretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:34:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 34, 1</bibl></cit>.—Cf. in the two senses, <hi rend="ital">to free from debt</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">to pay</hi>, in the same sentence: <cit><quote lang="la">non succurrere vis illi, sed solvere. Qui sic properat, ipse solvi vult, non solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:27:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 27, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.88" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> of the debt, <hi rend="ital">to discharge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pay</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam Fundanio debitum solutum esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:3:section=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 3, § 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc quod debeo peto a te ut ... solutum relinquas,</quote> <trans><tr>settled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solverat Castricio pecuniam jam diu debitam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 23, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quā (pensione) major pars est ei soluta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvi aes alienum Pompejus ex suo fisco jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:2:11" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aes alienum solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 36:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 36, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae jactatio est, solvisse quod debebas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:17:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 4, 17, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">debitum solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 6:30:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 30, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne pecunias creditas solverent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:35:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 35, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut creditae pecuniae solvantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex thensauris Gallicis creditum solvi posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 15, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita bona veneant ut solidum suum cuique solvatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:17:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 17, 46</bibl></cit>.—And of moral debts: <cit><quote lang="la">cum patriae quod debes solveris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Marcell. 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">debet vero, solvitque praeclare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliter beneficium, aliter creditum solvitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:34:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 34, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui grate beneficium accipit, primam ejus pensionem solvit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 2:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 22</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n44698.89" n="(d)" level="5"> By a confusion of construction, solvere pecuniam, etc., <hi rend="ital">to pay money</hi>, etc. (for pecuniā rem or debitum solvere); constr. with <case>dat.</case> or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">emi: pecuniam solvi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:20:section=43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 20, § 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro frumento nihil solvit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 72</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">169: legatis pecuniam pro frumento solvit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc pecuniam cum solvere in praesenti non posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi pecuniam solvisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,005:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cim. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">condiciones pacis dictae ut decem millia talentum argenti ... solverent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 37 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro quo (frumento) pretium solveret populus Romanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pretium servorum ex aerario solutum est dominis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:26:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 26, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pretium pro libris domino esse solvendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meritam mercedem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 22, 3</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 11, 4</bibl>: sorte creditum solvere, <hi rend="ital">by paying the principal</hi> (i. e. <hi rend="ital">without interest</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:36:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 36, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae praemia senatus militibus ante constituit, ea solvantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:14:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 14, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipendium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 32, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dotem mulieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:3:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 24, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litem aestimatam,</quote> <trans><tr>the amount of a fine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,005:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cim. 5, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbitria funeris,</quote> <trans><tr>the expenses of the funeral</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Red. Sen. 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvere dodrantem,</quote> <trans><tr>to pay seventy-five per cent</tr>.,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:9:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dona puer solvit,</quote> <trans><tr>paid the promised gifts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:794" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 794</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">munera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:104" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 104</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the dedication of a book, in return for favors: <cit><quote lang="la">et exspectabo ea (munera) quae polliceris, et erunt mihi pergrata si solveris ... Non solvam nisi prius a te cavero, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:4:17 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 4, 17 sq.</bibl></cit>—Of the delivery <cb n="SOLV" /> of slaves: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis duos homines promise rit et Stichum solverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:3:67" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 46, 3, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:3:38:section=3" default="NO">46, 3, 38, § 3</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: dolorem solvisti, <hi rend="ital">you have paid your grief</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">have duly mourned</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:6:98" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 6, 98</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> with personal subject: <cit><quote lang="la">si (actor) solutus fuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:1:31" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 12, 1, 31</bibl></cit> (cf.: solvere militem, <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign> supra). —（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) Esp., in certain phrases, <hi rend="ital">to pay</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid praesens solvere,</quote> <trans><tr>to pay in cash</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid de praesentibus solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 97:16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 97, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvere grates (= referre gratiam muneribus): Sulla solvit grates Dianae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:25" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas solvere grates sufficiam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:2:7" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: cum homo avarus, ut ea (beneficia) solveret sibi imperare non posset, etc., Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 12, 1</bibl>; cf.: non dicimus reposuit beneficium aut solvit; <cit><quote lang="la">nullum nobis placuit quod aeri alieno convenit verbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 81:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 81, 9</bibl></cit>; but v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:18:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 2, 18, 5</bibl>: in debitum solvere, <hi rend="ital">to make a partial payment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum haec epistula in debitum solvet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 7:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 7, 10</bibl></cit>: aliquid solvere ab aliquo (de aliquā re), <hi rend="ital">to pay out of funds supplied by any one</hi> (<hi rend="ital">out of any fund</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">Quintus laborat ut tibi quod debet ab Egnatio solvat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 18, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines dicere, se a me solvere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 21, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(summa) erat solvenda de meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operas solvere alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to work for somebody</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:7:39" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 7, 39</bibl></cit>: solvo operam Dianae, <hi rend="ital">I work for Diana</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">offer a sacrifice to her</hi>, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 12, 21</bibl>: judicatum solvere, <hi rend="ital">to pay the amount adjudged by the court</hi>, for which security (satisdatio) was required: <cit><quote lang="la">stipulatio quae appellatur judicatum solvi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:90" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iste postulat ut procurator judicatum solvi satisdaret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 7, 29</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:2:28" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 2, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:3:15" default="NO">3, 3, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:8:8" default="NO">2, 8, 8</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 8, 14 et saep.: auctio solvendis nummis,</quote> <trans><tr>a cash auction</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:35" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 35</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Gerund.</hi>: solvendo esse, <hi rend="ital">to be solvent;</hi> jurid. t. t., to be able to pay, i. e. one's debts; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in full: nec tamen solvendo aeri alieno respublica esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo dubitat solvendo esse eum qui defenditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:17:105" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 17, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui modo solvendo sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:3:121" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 3, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si solvendo sint,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 1, 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec interest, solvendo sit, necne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:1:49:section=5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 30, 1, 49, § 5</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:1:10" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 46, 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:1:27:section=2" default="NO">46, 1, 27, § 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:1:51" default="NO">46, 1, 51</bibl>, §§ 1 and 4; 46, 1, 52, § 1; 46, 1, 28; 50, 17, 198 et saep.: non solvendo esse, <hi rend="ital">to be insolvent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvendo non erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum solvendo civitates non essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu nec solvendo eras, nec, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne videatur non fuisse solvendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:22:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 22, 79</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and very freq. in the jurists.—So, trop.: quid matri, quid flebili patriae dabis? Solvendo non es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 941" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 941</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">*non esse ad solvendum (i. e. able to pay),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n44698.90" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To fulfil the duty</hi> of burial. </sense><sense id="n44698.91" n="(a)" level="5"> Justa solvere; with <hi rend="ital">dat. of the person</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui nondum omnia paterno funeri justa solvisset,</quote> <trans><tr>who had not yet finished the burial ceremonies of his father</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justis defunctorum corporibus solutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:12:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 12, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proinde corpori quam primum justa solvamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:6:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut justa soluta Remo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:452" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 452</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc justa nato solve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 1245" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 1245</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.92" n="(b)" level="5"> Exsequias, inferias or suprema solvere: <cit><quote lang="la">exsequiis rite solutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruor sancto solvit inferias viro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 1198" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 1198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvere suprema militibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 61</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.93" n="c" level="4"> Votum solvere, <hi rend="ital">to fulfil a vow</hi> to the gods. </sense><sense id="n44698.94" n="(a)" level="5"> Alone: <cit><quote lang="la">vota ea quae numquam solveret nuncupavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si factum esset, votum rite solvi non posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberare et se et rempublicam religione votis solvendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:44:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 44, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">placatis diis votis rite solvendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petiit ut votum sibi solvere liceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animosius a mercatore quam a vectore solvitur votum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 73:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 73, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vota pro incolumitate solvebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vota pater solvit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:707" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 707</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne votum solvat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:91:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 91, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:4:2" default="NO">8, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:9:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 9, 5</bibl> <hi rend="ital">ext.;</hi> 1, 1, 8 <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi>—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">voti debita solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:596" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 596</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">the abbrev. formula V. S. L. M. (voTVM SOLVIT LIBENS MERITO),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 186</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1296</bibl> sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">V.S.A.L. (ANIMO LIBENTI),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2022</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra solvere (=votum solvere),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 1, 427</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.95" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ait sese Veneri velle votum solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. prol. 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vota Jovi solvo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:652" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 652</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 153</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt vota soluta deae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:248" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 248</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dis vota solvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:19:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 19, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libamenta Veneri solvere (=votum per libamenta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:5:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 18, 5, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.96" n="d" level="4"> Fidem solvere, <hi rend="ital">to fulfil a promise</hi> (post-class. for fidem praestare, <pb n="1728" /> <cb n="SOLV" /> exsolvere; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem obligatam liberare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 9</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">illi, ut fidem solverent, clipeis obruere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:1:12" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 1, 12</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">similarly: et voti solverat ille fidem (=votum solverat),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:642" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 642</bibl></cit>; but cf.: itane imprudens? tandem inventa'st causa: solvisti fidem, <hi rend="ital">you have found a pretext to evade your promise</hi> (cf. II. A. 3.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 1, 18</bibl>: esset, quam dederas, morte soluta fides, <hi rend="ital">by my death your promise to marry me would have been cancelled</hi> (cf. II. B. 1. 6.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 10, 78</bibl>; similarly: suam fidem (i. e. quam Lepido habuerit) solutam esse, <hi rend="ital">that his faith in Lepidus was broken</hi>, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 21, 3</bibl>.—With a different construction: se depositi fide solvere, <hi rend="ital">to acquit one's self of the duty to return property intrusted to him</hi> (cf. I. B. 1. c.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:3:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 3, 5</bibl> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi>: factique fide data munera solvit, <hi rend="ital">he freed the gift already given from the obligation of an accomplished fact</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">he revoked the gifts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">although already made</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 135</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n44698.97" n="e" level="4"> Promissum solvere, <hi rend="ital">to fulfil a promise</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">perinde quasi promissum solvens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:6:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvitur quod cuique promissum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. Marc. 20" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. Marc. 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">similarly: solutum, quod juraverant, rebantur,</quote> <trans><tr>what they had promised under oath</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 18, 5</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏlūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">free</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at large</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfettered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unbandaged.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44698.98" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44698.99" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to I.A. 1. supra.) Pigeat nostrum erum si eximat aut solutos sinat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi moram facis quom ego solutus sto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 5, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reus solutus causam dicis, testes vinctos attines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum eos vinciret quos secum habebat, te solutum Romam mittebat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quisquam ante Marium solutus dicitur esse sectus,</quote> <trans><tr>unbandaged</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:22:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 22, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duos (captivos) solutos ire ad Hannibalem jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum interdiu solutum custodes sequebantur, nocte clausum asservabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:45:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 45, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non efficiatis ut solutos verear quos alligatos adduxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:2:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.100" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to I. A. 2.) Of texture, etc.; esp. of soil, <hi rend="ital">loose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">friable</hi> (opp spissus; <cit><quote lang="la">postAug.): quo solutior terra facilius pateat radicibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:21" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 21</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">ordeum nisi solutum et siccum locum non patitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soluta et facilis terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 14</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">solum solutum vel spissum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 2 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">seri vult raphanus terrā solutā, umidā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 26, § 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hordeum seri non vult, nisi in siccā et solutā terrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 7, 18, § 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solutiores ripae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 15" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 15</bibl></cit>.—Of plants: <cit><quote lang="la">mas spissior, femina solutior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 9, 57, § 103</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏlūtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a state of looseness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum vult describere, quem ad modum alia torqueantur fila, alia ex molli solutoque ducantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:20" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.101" n="3" level="3"> (Acc. to I. A. 3.) <hi rend="ital">Rarefied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diffused</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbo, quo celsior eo solutior laxiorque est, et ob hoc diffunditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:9:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 7, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër agitatus a sole calefactusque solutior est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 1:2:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">debet aër nec tam spissus esse, nec tam tenuis et solutus, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 1:2:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.102" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44698.103" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to I. B. 1.) Of speech, <hi rend="ital">unfettered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fluent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ready</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(orator) solutus in explicandis sententiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:47:173" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 47, 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbis solutus satis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 47, 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solutissimus in dicendo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 48, 180</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.104" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Exempt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">free</hi> from duties, obligations, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quam ob rem viderer maximis beneficii vinculis obstrictus, cum liber essem et solutus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:30:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 30, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soluta (praedia) meliore in causā sunt quam obligata,</quote> <trans><tr>unmortgaged</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 3, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si reddidi (debitum), solutus sum ac liber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:18:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 18, 5</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">non ut gratus, sed ut solutus sim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 4:21:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 21, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">solutus omni fenore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:4" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">nam eā (religione) magister equitum solutus ac liber potuerit esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:32:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 32, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mamertini soli in omni orbe terrarum vacui, expertes soluti ac liberi fuerunt ab omni sumptu, molestiā, munere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:10:section=23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 10, § 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.105" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Free from punishment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not punishable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not liable</hi>, etc.: qui mancipia vendunt, certiores faciunt emptores quis fugitivus sit, noxave solutus, Edict. Aedil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:1:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 1, § 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:2:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 2, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod aiunt aediles noxae solutus non sit sic intellegendum est ... noxali judicio subjectum non esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:17:section=17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 17, § 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud quos libido etiam permissam habet et solutam licentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:4:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 4, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne illud tempus habeat per me solutum ac liberum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>let the crimes then committed be unpunished</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:12:section=33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 12, § 33</bibl></cit>: antea vacuum id solutumque poenā <cb n="SOLV" /> fuerat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 28</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">subj. inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">maxime solutum fuit, prodere de iis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 35</bibl></cit>: solutum existimatur esse, alteri male dicere, Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 7, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.106" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Free from cares</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undistracted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animo soluto liberoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:75:section=185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 75, § 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed paulo solutiore tamen animo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 31</bibl></cit>, § 82.—</sense><sense id="n44698.107" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">At leisure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">free from labor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">business</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">te rogo ut eum solutum, liberum, confectis ejus negotiis a te, quamprimum ad me remittas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:63:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 63, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo mea ratio facilior et solutior esse possit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Genium Curabis Cum famulis operum solutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:17:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 17, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.108" n="6" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Unbound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relaxed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">merry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jovial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam homines soluti ridere non desinant, tristiores autem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:39:104" default="NO"
