valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 39, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an tu existimas quemquam soluto vultu et hilari oculo mortem contemnere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 23:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 23, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:355" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 355</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(mores) naturam sequentium faciles sunt, soluti sunt,</quote> <trans><tr>unembarrassed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 122:17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 122, 17</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n44698.109" n="7" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Free</hi> from the rule of others, <hi rend="ital">uncontrolled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">independent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum videas civitatis voluntatem solutam, virtutem alligatam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab omni imperio externo soluta in perpetuum Hispania,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Masinissae ab imperio Romano solutam libertatem tribuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:2:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incerti, solutique, et magis sine domino quam in libertate, Vononem in regnum accipiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum (militum) libertas solutior erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:2:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—Of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">rectore solutos (solis) equos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:219" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 219</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n44698.110" n="8" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Free</hi> from influence or restraint; hence, <hi rend="ital">independent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unbiassed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unprejudiced</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero deus ipse alio modo intellegi potest, nisi mens soluta quaedam et libera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:27:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 27, 66</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">cum animi sine ratione motu ipsi suo soluto ac libero incitarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicio senatus soluto et libero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:15:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 15, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sum enim ad dignitatem in re publicā solutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libero tempore cum soluta vobis est eligendi optio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:10:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si omnia mihi essent solutissima, tamen in re publicā non alius essem atque nunc sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberi enim ad causas solutique veniebant,</quote> <trans><tr>uncommitted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:78:section=192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 78, § 192</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.111" n="9" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Free</hi> from moral restraint; hence, <hi rend="ital">unbridled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insolent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amores soluti et liberi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:4:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 4, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">licentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populi quamvis soluti ecfrenatique sint,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 34, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis erat qui sibi solutam P. Clodii praeturam sine maximo metu proponeret? Solutam autem fore videbatis, nisi esset is consul qui eam auderet possetque constringere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:13:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 13, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quominus conspectus, eo solutior erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescentes aliquot quorum, in regno, libido solutior fuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solutioris vitae primos adulescentiae annos egisse fertur,</quote> <trans><tr>a licentious life</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:6:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectandi solutissimum morem corrigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores soluti,</quote> <trans><tr>licentious habits</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:3:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 3, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.112" n="10" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Regardless of rules</hi>, <hi rend="ital">careless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">orator tam solutus et mollis in gestu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:62:225" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 62, 225</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicta factaque ejus solutiora, et quandam sui neglegentiam praeferentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.113" n="11" level="3"> Esp., of style, etc., <hi rend="ital">free from rules of composition.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44698.114" n="(a)" level="5"> Oratio soluta, verba soluta, <hi rend="ital">a free style</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conversational</hi> or <hi rend="ital">epistolary style</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">est oratio aliqua vincta atque contexta, soluta alia, qualis in sermone et epistulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:20" default="NO">9, 4, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:69" default="NO">9, 4, 69</bibl>; 9, 4, 77.—</sense><sense id="n44698.115" n="(b)" level="5"> More freq.: verba soluta, oratio soluta, <hi rend="ital">prose</hi> (opp. to verse); <cit><quote lang="la">in full: scribere conabar verba soluta modis, Ov Tr. 4, 10, 24: quod (Isocrates) verbis solutis numeros primus adjunxerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:52:174" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 52, 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mollis est enim oratio philosophorum ... nec vincta numeris, sed soluta liberius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 19, 64</bibl></cit>; 71, 234; <cit><quote lang="la">68, 228: si omnes solutā oratione scripserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 4:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 4, 1</bibl></cit>; de heisce rebus treis libros ad te mittere institui; <cit><quote lang="la">de oratione solutā duos, de poëticā unum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> L. L. 6, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in solutā oratione, sic in poëmateis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 7:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primus (Isocrates) intellexit. etiam in solutā oratione, dum versum effugeres modum et numerum quemdam debere servari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:8:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 8, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aristoteles judicat heroum numerum grandiorem quam desideret soluta oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:57:192" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 57, 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et creticus et paeon quam commodissume putatur in solutam orationem illigari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 64, 215</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a modis quibusdam, cantu remoto, soluta esse videatur oratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 55, 183</bibl></cit>; 55, 184; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:48:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 48, 184</bibl>: historia est quodammodo <cb n="SOMN" /> carmen solutum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.116" n="(g)" level="5"> Also in reference to a prose rhythm, <hi rend="ital">loose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unrhythmical</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inharmonious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut verba neque inligata sint, quasi ... versus, neque ita soluta ut vagentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:44:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 44, 176</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 48, 186</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero haec (Callidii verba) soluta nec diffluentia, sed astricta numeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:79:274" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 79, 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orator sic illigat sententiam verbis ut eam numero quodam complectatur et astricto et soluto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:44:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 44, 175</bibl></cit>; but: verba soluta suis figuris, <hi rend="ital">words freed from their proper meaning</hi>, i.e. <hi rend="ital">metaphors</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 1, 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.117" n="(d)" level="5"> Rarely with reference to the thought: soluta oratio, <hi rend="ital">a fragmentary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disconnected style</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">soluta oratio, et e singulis non membris, sed frustis, collata, structurā caret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 27</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solutiora componere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:4:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:15" default="NO">9, 4, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.118" n="12" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Effeminate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">luxurious</hi> (acc. to I. B. 3.): <cit><quote lang="la">sinum togae in dextrum umerum reicere, solutum ac delicatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:146" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 146</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.119" n="13" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Undisciplined</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disorderly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia soluta apud hostes esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 30, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil temeritate solutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud Achaeos neglecta omnia ac soluta fuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 34, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.120" n="14" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Lax</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remiss</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weak</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea lenitas adhuc si cui solutior visa erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ciceronem male audivisse, tamquam solutum et enervem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soluti ac fluentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—Hence: <cit><quote lang="la">solutum genus orationis,</quote> <trans><tr>a lifeless</tr>, <tr>dull style</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:10:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanto longius abscederent, eo solutiore curā,</quote> <trans><tr>laxer attention</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 8, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.121" n="C" level="2"> (Acc. to II. B. 3. <foreign lang="greek">e</foreign> supra.) <hi rend="ital">Paid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discharged</hi>, only as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏlūtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">that which is paid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a discharged debt</hi>, in certain phrases: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in solutum dare,</quote> <trans><tr>to give something in payment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:3:45" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 46, 3, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:3:46" default="NO">46, 3, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:3:60" default="NO">46, 3, 60</bibl>: in solutum accipere, <hi rend="ital">to accept in payment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui voluntatem bonam in solutum accipit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:16:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui rem in solutum accipit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:4:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 42, 4, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:1:19" default="NO">12, 1, 19</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">in solutum imputare,</quote> <trans><tr>to charge as payment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 8:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 8, 10</bibl></cit>; aliquid pro soluto est, <hi rend="ital">is considered as paid</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cancelled</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro soluto id in quo creditor accipiendo moram fecit, oportet esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:3:72" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 46, 3, 72</bibl></cit>: pro soluto usucapere, <hi rend="ital">to acquire by prescription something given in payment by the debtor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but not belonging to him</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro soluto usucapit qui rem debiti causā recepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:3:46" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 3, 46</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏlūtē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n44698.122" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Thinly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora diffusa solute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.123" n="2" level="3"> Of speech, <hi rend="ital">fluently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non refert videre quid dicendum est, nisi id queas solute ac suaviter dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:29:110" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 29, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita facile soluteque volvebat sententias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 81, 280</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ipse compositus alias, et velut eluctantium verborum, solutius promptiusque eloquebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.124" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Irregularly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loosely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a fabris neglegentius solutiusque composita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:30:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 30, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.125" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Freely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without restraint</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">generaliter puto judicem justum ... solutius aequitatem sequi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>without strictly regarding the letter of the law</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:7:14:section=13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 7, 14, § 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.126" n="5" level="3"> Of style, <hi rend="ital">without connection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loosely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">enuntiare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 47</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.127" n="6" level="3"> Of manners and discipline, <hi rend="ital">disorderly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">negligently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecipue sub imperio Cn. Manlii solute ac neglegenter habiti sunt (exercitus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in stationibus solute ac neglegenter agentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:37:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 37, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.128" n="7" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Weakly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tamely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without vigor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ille tam solute egisset, tam leniter, tam oscitanter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:80:277" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 80, 277</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44698.129" n="8" level="3"> Of morals, <hi rend="ital">loosely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without restraint</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventitabat illuc Nero, quo solutius urbem extra lasciviret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
solyma: <entryFree id="n44699" type="main" key="So^ly^ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŏlyma</orth>, <itype>ōrum and ae</itype>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŏlymi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŏlymus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Hierosolyma.</entryFree>
solymus: <entryFree id="n44700" type="main" key="So^ly^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŏlymus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŏlĭmus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44700.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Trojan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the founder of Sulmo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:79" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:72" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 72</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
somnialis: <entryFree id="n44701" type="gloss" key="somni^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">somnĭālis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>somnium</etym>, <sense id="n44701.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dreambringing</hi>, an epithet of Hercules, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 692, 130</bibl>; Inscr. Rein. cl. 10, 4.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">somnĭālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a dream</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 2, 17</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
somniator: <entryFree id="n44702" type="main" key="somni^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">somnĭātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>somnio</etym>, <sense id="n44702.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who has faith in dreams; a dreamer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 3:22:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 3, 22, 15</bibl>.—Of Joseph, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Gnost. 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:37:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 37, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Zech. 10, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
somniculose: <entryFree id="n44703" type="main" key="somni^cu^lo_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">somnĭcŭlōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. somniculosus <sense id="n44703.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
somniculosus: <entryFree id="n44704" type="main" key="somni^cu^lo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">somnĭcŭlōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>somnus</etym>, <sense id="n44704.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of sleep</hi>, i. e. </sense><sense id="n44704.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inclined to sleep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drowsy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dozy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sleepy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sluggish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slothful</hi> (rare <pb n="1729" /> <cb n="SOMN" /> but class.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">sopitus): quae vitia non sunt senectutis, sed inertis, ignavae, somniculosae senectutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:11:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 11, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">villicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus mancipiorum (with socors),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:8:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:58:36" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 58, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Etesiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:11:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 11, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44704.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">making sleepy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drowsy</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">sluggish</hi>: aspis, i. e. <hi rend="ital">causing torpor</hi> or <hi rend="ital">numbness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">palsying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deadly</hi> (cf. somnifer and somnificus), Cinna ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:12:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 12, 12</bibl>; Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 172, 30</bibl> (Com. Fragm. 86 Rib.).—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">somnĭ-cŭlōsē</orth> (acc. to I.), <hi rend="ital">sleepily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lazily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sluggishly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">persequi eri imperia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
somnifer: <entryFree id="n44705" type="main" key="somni^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">somnĭfer</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>somnus-fero</etym>, <sense id="n44705.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sleep-bringing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soporific</hi>, <hi rend="ital">somniferous</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">vis papaveris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 25, 61, § 229</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virga (Mercurii),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:672" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 672</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspis,</quote> <trans><tr>causing torpidity</tr>, <tr>deadly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:701" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 701</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">venenum (aspidis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:693" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 693</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strychnos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 74</bibl></cit>; cf. somniculosus, II., and somnificus.</sense></entryFree>
somnificus: <entryFree id="n44706" type="main" key="somni^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">somnĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>somnus-facio</etym>, <sense id="n44706.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">causing sleep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">narcotic</hi> (Plinian): <cit><quote lang="la">crater,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 57, § 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis aspidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 4, 17, § 63</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
somniger: <entryFree id="n44707" type="main" key="somni^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">somnĭger</orth>, <itype>gĕra, gĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>somnusgero</etym>, <sense id="n44707.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sleep-bringing</hi> (very rare for somnifer): <cit><quote lang="la">cornua Lunae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Dracont.</author> 1, 212</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
somnio: <entryFree id="n44708" type="main" key="somni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">somnĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (<sense id="n44708.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> collat. form: <cit><quote lang="la">hic aedes non somniatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 74, 14</bibl></cit>) [somnium], <hi rend="ital">to dream; to dream of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">see in a dream</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n44708.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirum atque inscitum somniavi somnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">somnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid (in somnis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 1, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 6, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:59:121 al" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 59, 121 al.</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ovum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:65:134" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 65, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">speciem fortunae querentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:18 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 18 al.</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">me somnies, me exspectes, de me cogites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 114</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi>: videbar somniare med ego esse mortuum, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 16, 51</bibl> (Epich. v. 1, p. 167 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:20:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 20, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 65, 134</bibl> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:91" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 91</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:37 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 37 al.</bibl>—With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc credo causam de illo somniandi fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:67:140" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 67, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer, de quo somniasset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">totas noctes somniamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:59:121" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 59, 121</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 16, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 75, 98, § 211</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:46 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 46 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aristoteles et Fabianus plurimum somniari circa ver et auctumnum tradunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 14, § 54</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n44708.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, as in Engl. <hi rend="ital">to dream</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to think idly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vainly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to talk foolishly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eho, quae tu somnias! Hic homo non sanus est,</quote> <trans><tr>what are you dreaming about?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos Summanos somnias?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: de Lanuvino Phameae erravi; <cit><quote lang="la">Trojanum somniabam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 13, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ineptias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:8:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ah stulte! tu de Psaltriā me somnias Agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 3, 5</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigilans somniat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">portenta non disserentium philosophorum sed somniantium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:8:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 8, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
somniosus: <entryFree id="n44709" type="main" key="somni^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">somnĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>somnus</etym>, <sense id="n44709.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sleepy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overcome by sleep</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:5:51" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 5, 51</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
somnium: <entryFree id="n44710" type="main" key="somni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">somnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n44710.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a dream</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:20:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 20, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 58, 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 75, 98, § 211</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 3</bibl>; Lact. Opif. Dei, 18: rex Priamus somnio perculsus, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:21:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 21, 42</bibl> (Trag. v. 59 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">dum huic conicio somnium,</quote> <trans><tr>interpret</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 1, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">interpretes somniorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:58:132" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 58, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jucundissima somnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:20:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 20, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per somnia loquentes,</quote> <trans><tr>talking in their sleep</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1158</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae somnio visa fuerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 6, 11</bibl></cit> Weissenb.—</sense><sense id="n44710.1" n="B" level="2"> Personified: Somnia, <hi rend="ital">dreams</hi>, as divinities, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:17:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 17, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:588" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 588</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 614</bibl> sq—</sense><sense id="n44710.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44710.3" n="A" level="2"> For any thing idle, silly, or without foundation (cf. somnio, II.), <hi rend="ital">a dream</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an idle whim</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fancy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stuff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nonsense</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu, quantus quantus, nihil nisi sapientia es: Ille somnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de argento, somnium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:6:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 6, 34</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabulae! ... logi! ... somnia!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et vigilans stertis nec somnia cernere cessas,</quote> <trans><tr>visions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1048" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1048</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 105</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes inanes et velut somnia quaedam vigilantium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: exposui fere non <cb n="SOMN" /> philosophorum judicia, sed delirantium somnia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:16:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 16, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Chrysippus Stoicorum somniorum vaferrimus interpres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 15, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leviter curare videtur, Quo promissa cadant et somnia Pythagorea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44710.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Somnus, tibi somnia tristia portans,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>fatal sleep</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:840" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 840</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
somnulentia: <entryFree id="n44711" type="main" key="somnu^lenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">somnŭlentĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">somnŏl-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <etym>somnulentus</etym>, <sense id="n44711.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sleepiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drowsiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">somnolence</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
somnulentus: <entryFree id="n44712" type="main" key="somnu^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">somnŭlentus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">somnŏl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>somnus</etym>, <sense id="n44712.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of sleep</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">sleepy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drowsy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dozy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">somnolent</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10</bibl>, p. 251, 37.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">somnŏlen-ter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">sleepily</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 20, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
somnurnus: <entryFree id="n44713" type="hapax" key="somnurnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">somnurnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.; in analogy with nocturnus, diurnus</etym>, <sense id="n44713.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to sleep</hi>: imagines, <hi rend="ital">seen in sleep</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 172, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
somnus: <entryFree id="n44714" type="main" key="somnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">somnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. svap-nas; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">u(/pnos</foreign>; som-nus for sop-nus; cf.: sopor, sopio</etym>. <sense id="n44714.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">sleep</hi>: hostes vino domiti somnoque sepulti, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6</bibl> (Ann. v. 291 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 133</bibl>: vix aegro cum corde meo me somnus reliquit, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:20:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 20, 40</bibl> (Ann. v. 52 Vahl.); cf., on the contrary: pandite sulti' genas et corde relinquite somnum, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=343" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 343</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 521 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">somnum capere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 115</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 19, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnum videre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caninius suo toto consulatu somnum non vidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 30, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnum tenere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:80:278" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 80, 278</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somno se dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:47:113" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 47, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me artior quam solebat somnus complexus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:10:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puella somno fessa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:88" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somno vincta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 238</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hos oppressos somno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne me e somno excitetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:12:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 12, 12</bibl></cit>: so, <cit><quote lang="la">ex somno excitare aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 8, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e somno suscitari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:19:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 19, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somno solutus sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:26:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 26, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ergo est somno sevocatus animus a societate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:30:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 30, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palpebrae somno coniventes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:57:143" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 57, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somno languidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:106" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 106</bibl></cit>: in somnis aliquid videre, <hi rend="ital">in sleep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in dreams</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=325" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 325</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 228 Vahl.); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 2, 10</bibl>; Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:21:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 21, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:29:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 29, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:24:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 24, 49</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 25, 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 53, 121</bibl>; 2, 70, 144; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:270" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 270</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 466</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 557 al.</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">less freq.: per somnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:11:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 11, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:36:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 36, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:636" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 636</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">per somnos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 24, § 49</bibl></cit>; cf.: ea si cui in somno accidant, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:22:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 22, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">datur in somnum euntibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 47, § 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnum petiere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:676" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 676</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducere somnos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>protract slumber</tr>, <tr>continue to sleep</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:560" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 560</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">trahere quietem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:14:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 14, 9</bibl></cit>); so, <cit><quote lang="la">educere somnos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:405" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 405</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">but: pocula ducentia somnos,</quote> <trans><tr>causing sleep</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:14:3" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba placidos facientia somnos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuces somnum faciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 8, 75, § 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odor somnum gignit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 19, 77, § 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnum parere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 8, 38, § 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 2, 11, § 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conciliare (opp. fugare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 18, 22, § 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 17, 73, § 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adlicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 3, 8, § 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnos invitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:28" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adimere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 25, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avertere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rumpere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:167" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perturbare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">conditque natantia lumina somnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:496" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 496</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labi ut somnum sensit in artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:631" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 631</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 24, 24, § 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">graviore somno premi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 13, 15, § 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voltus in somnum cadit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 1044" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 1044</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somno cedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:71" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumina mergere somno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnus altus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somni faciles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 11, 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">somno mollior herba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somni pingues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 13, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:354" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 354</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intermissus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:6:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lenis et placidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 1075" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 1075</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 1051" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1051</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servus ad somnum,</quote> <trans><tr>who keeps watch during one's sleep</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:11:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 11, 3</bibl></cit>.—Personified: Somnus, as <hi rend="ital">a divinity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son of Erebus and Nox</hi>, Hyg. Fab. praef.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:838" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 838</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 390</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:586:11:593" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 586, 11, 593</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 623</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:87" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:90 al" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 90 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n44714.1" n="B" level="2"> Esp., in reproachful sense, <hi rend="ital">sleep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sloth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drowsiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inactivity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slumber</hi>, <hi rend="ital">idleness</hi>, etc.: corde relinquite somnum, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=343" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 343</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 521 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">dediti ventri ac somno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somno et conviviis et delectationi nati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:66:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 66, 138</bibl></cit>: somno <cb n="SONO" /> et luxu pudendus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 90</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">somno indulsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 16, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dediti somno ciboque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 1, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44714.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf. </sense><sense id="n44714.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Night</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Libra die somnique pares ubi fecerit horas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 208</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:200" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 200</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n44714.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Death</hi> (mostly with <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">longus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:11:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 11, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">componit lumina somno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:529" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 529</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">niger,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:633" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 633</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:178" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 178</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">SO, SOMNO AETERNO SACRVM,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4428</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">REQVIESCIT IN SOMNO PACIS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1121</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44714.5" n="C" level="2"> Of a calm at sea: <cit><quote lang="la">pigro torpebant aequora somno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:2:73" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 2, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbelli recubant litora somno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:256" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 3, 256</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n44714.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A dream</hi>: exterrita somno, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:20:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 20, 40</bibl> (Ann. v. 37 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">promissa somni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:216" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 216</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sonabilis: <entryFree id="n44715" type="hapax" key="so^na_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏnābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sono</etym>, <sense id="n44715.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sounding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noisy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sistrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:784" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 784</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sonans: <entryFree id="n44716" type="main" key="so^nans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏnans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of sono.</entryFree>
sonax: <entryFree id="n44717" type="main" key="so^nax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏnax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sono</etym>, <sense id="n44717.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sounding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noisy</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post - Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">concha,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 157, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentium attritus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8</bibl></cit>, p. 202, 30.</sense></entryFree>
sonchus: <entryFree id="n44718" type="greek" key="sonchus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sonchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">so/gxos</foreign>, <sense id="n44718.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the herb sow-thistle</hi>: Sonchus oleraceus, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 22, 44, § 88</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sonipes: <entryFree id="n44719" type="main" key="so^ni^pe_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏnĭ-pēs</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sŏnŭpēs</orth>), <itype>pĕdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sonus</etym>, <sense id="n44719.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with sounding feet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noisy-footed</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">turba (in Isidis sacris),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 43</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noisy-foot</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a horse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a prancer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fremit aequore toto Insultans sonipes et pressis pugnat habenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:600" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 600</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:222" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 222</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:334" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 334</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:3 al" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 3 al.</bibl> (in Cic., sonipedes is cited as an example of a fourth pæon, de Or. 3, 47, 183).</sense></entryFree>
sonito: <entryFree id="n44720" type="hapax" key="so^ni^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏnĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n44720.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [sono], <hi rend="ital">to make a noise</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cicadae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 2, § 40</bibl></cit> dub. (al. so nant).</sense></entryFree>
sonitus: <entryFree id="n44721" type="main" key="so^ni^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏnĭtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (<sense id="n44721.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> soniti, Pac. and Cae cil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 491, 24 sq.</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a noise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">din</hi>, etc. (class.; in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>): at tuba terribili sonitu taratantara dixit, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 842</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 452 Vahl.); cf.: lituus sonitus effudit acutos, id. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=116" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 116</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 522 Vahl.): summo sonitu quatit ungula terram, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 281 Vahl.); <cit><quote lang="la">imitated by Virg. A. 8, 596: ungularum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumultuosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 52</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">forum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 5, 1, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">armorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:474" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 474</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:669" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 669</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tubae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 15, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tubarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:616" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 616</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stertentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 10, 12, § 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Olympi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the thunder</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:586" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 586</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(ignis) ingentem caelo sonitum dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:306" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 306</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utero sonitum quater arma dedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 243</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 667</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonitum (veneni e poculo ejecti) reddere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:40:96" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 40, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fragor et sonitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum sonitus inanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:12:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 12, 51</bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nosti jam in hac materiā sonitus nostros,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>my thundering speech</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 14, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">innumeros aeris sonitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:1:68" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 1, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonituum discrimina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 89</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of an abstract subject: quae (eloquentia) cursu magno sonituque ferretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:28:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 28, 97</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sonivius: <entryFree id="n44722" type="main" key="so^ni^vi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏnĭvĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sonus</etym>, <sense id="n44722.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">noisy</hi> (cf. solistimum), only in the phrase sonivium tripudium, of the rattling of the corn upon the ground as it fell from the mouths of the sacred chickens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 6, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 22, 24, § 86</bibl>; cf. Fest. pp. 290, 291, and 297 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
sono: <entryFree id="n44723" type="main" key="so^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏno</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ĭtum, 1</itype> (ante-class. collat. form acc. to the 3d conj., sonit, Enn. and Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 504, 32 sq.</bibl>; sonunt, Enn. and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:ib. 505:11 sq" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> ib. 505, 11 sq.</bibl>; Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 863</bibl> P.; <sense id="n44723.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> sonĕre, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 505</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 156</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">part. fut.</hi> sonaturum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 44</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> sonaverint, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Scap. 3</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> sonantum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:34:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 34, 12</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [Sanscr. svan-, to sound; cf. O. H. Germ. svana; Engl. swan]. </sense><sense id="n44723.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make a noise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resound</hi>: aes sonit, <hi rend="ital">the trumpet sounds</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 504, 33</bibl> (Trag. v. 213 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">plectra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 7, 62: tympana, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:105:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 105, 4</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">cujanam vox prope me sonat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic mare sonat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 3, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mare, silvae Aquilone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:13:3" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 13, 3</bibl></cit>: omne sonabat arbustum fremitu silvaï <pb n="1730" /> <cb n="SONS" /> frondosaï, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 2</bibl> (Ann. v. 196 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">clamore viri, stridore rudentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:495" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 495</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia passim mulierum puerorumque ... ploratibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 17</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">(hirundo) circum Stagna sonat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:477" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 477</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:223" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 223</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saeva sonare Verbera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:557" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 557</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classica sonant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 637</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">displosa sonat vesica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fletus rixaeque sonant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:4:37" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 4, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura fert, ut extrema ex alterā parte graviter, ex alterā autem acute sonent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:18:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 18, 18</bibl></cit>: dicta non sonant, <hi rend="ital">do not chink</hi> (i. e. <hi rend="ital">are not money</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 74</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jubet tibias agere: sonatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 165</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44723.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">utter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give utterance to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">call</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cry out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pour forth</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">edo, eloquor, cano): homines inconditis vocibus inchoatum quiddam et confusum sonantes,</quote> <trans><tr>uttering</tr>, <tr>pronouncing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonare subagreste quiddam,</quote> <trans><tr>to speak</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:74:259" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 74, 259</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pingue quiddam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 10, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(Sibylla) nec mortale sonans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa sonat raucum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:289" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 289</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vox hominem sonat,</quote> <trans><tr>does not sound like that of a human being</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:328" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 328</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tale sonat populus,</quote> <trans><tr>calls</tr>, <tr>cries out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:606" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 606</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exululatque Evoeque sonat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:597" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 597</bibl></cit>; 4, 523: atavos et avorum antiqua sonans Nomina, <hi rend="ital">boasting of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vaunting</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">crepans, jactans),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:529" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 529</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sonant te voce minores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:491" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 491</bibl></cit>: ut haec duo (honestas et utilitas) verbo inter se discrepare, re unum sonare videantur, <hi rend="ital">to signify</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">significare, indicare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:21:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 21, 83</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quā deterius nec Ille sonat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:91" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Epicurum non intellegere interdum, quid sonet haec vox voluptatis, id est, quae res huic voci subiciatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furem sonuere juvenci,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>they betrayed him by their lowings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 9, 13: <cit><quote lang="la">Pythius in longā carmina veste sonat,</quote> <trans><tr>sings</tr>, <tr>pours forth</tr>, <tr>accompanies on the lyre</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 31</bibl></cit> (3, 29), 16; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sonante mixtum tibiis carmen lyra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:9:5" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te sonantem ... dura fugae mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 13, 26</bibl></cit>: te carmina nostra sonabunt, <hi rend="ital">shall sing of</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">shall celebrate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">praise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extol</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 205</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Germanas acies, Daca proelia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:2:66" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 2, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acta viri laudesque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Ecl. 1, 26</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive mendaci lyrā Voles sonari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:40" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 40</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">magno nobis ore sonandus eris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 206</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏ-nans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">noisy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sounding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sonorous</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">meatus animae gravior et sonantior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 16, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod est sonantius et elatius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 7:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 12, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sonor: <entryFree id="n44724" type="main" key="so^nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏnor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sono</etym>, <sense id="n44724.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a noise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">din</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose for sonitus and sonus); <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:644" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 644</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:567" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 567</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:570" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 570</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 199</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:462" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 462</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 65</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 48</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 258</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.— Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:334" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 334</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1185" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 1185</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:651" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 651</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:306" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 306</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 1, p. 9, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Flor. 3, p. 357, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sonore: <entryFree id="n44725" type="main" key="so^no_re_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏnōrē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. sonorus <sense id="n44725.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sonoritas: <entryFree id="n44726" type="main" key="so^no_ri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏnōrĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sonorus</etym>, = <foreign lang="greek">eu)fwni/a</foreign>, <sense id="n44726.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fulness of sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">melodiousness</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 541</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1220</bibl> P; Sarisb. 1, 16.</sense></entryFree>
sonorus: <entryFree id="n44727" type="main" key="so^no_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏnōrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏnōris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> 497</bibl> and 498), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sonor</etym>, <sense id="n44727.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">noisy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sounding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resounding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sonorous</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose for the class. sonans): <cit><quote lang="la">cithara,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:69" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> in Ruf. 2, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestates sonoras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tonitru,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pelage,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 35</bibl></cit> Lachm.: <cit><quote lang="la">flumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:34" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phocis (on account of the Delphic oracle),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 281</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insula fluctibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Gild. 512</bibl></cit>: versus qui crepitant pronuntiatione fragosā et exsultantem informant dictionem, ut (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:503" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 503</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">at tuba terribilem, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 498</bibl></cit> P.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏnōrē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">loudly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oscitavit (with clare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:20:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 20, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sons: <entryFree id="n44728" type="main" key="sons"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sons</orth>, <itype>sontis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (<sense id="n44728.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. sing.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=297" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 297</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 12</bibl>) [<mood>Part.</mood> from root as-, es-; Sanscr. as-mi; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ei\mi/</foreign>; Lat. esum, sum; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)teo/s, e)th/tumos</foreign>; prop. he who was it, the real person, the guilty one]. </sense><sense id="n44728.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Guilty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">criminal; subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a guilty person</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an offender</hi>, <hi rend="ital">malefactor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">criminal</hi> (freq. and class., esp. as <hi rend="ital">subst.;</hi> syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">reus, nocens): anima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:854" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 854</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:618" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 618</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:847" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 847</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">di,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:610" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 610</bibl></cit>: manus foedata sanguine sonti (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> for sontis), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:563" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 563</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">morae ab igne supremo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:641" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 641</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: sontes condemnant<cb n="SOPH" />  reos, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(minores magistratus) vincla sontium servanto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">punire sontes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:24:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 24, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insontes, sicuti sontes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manes Virginiae nullo relicto sonte tandem quieverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 58 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>;
