<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 8, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:522" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 522</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 697</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 268</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Gen. plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sontum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:475" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 475</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44728.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Hurtful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noxious</hi>, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=297:22" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 297, 22</bibl> (but no example is preserved).— </sense><sense id="n44728.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr. sing.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offence</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Aldh.</author> Ep. 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sontiates: <entryFree id="n44729" type="main" key="Sonti^a_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sontĭātes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44729.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a powerful tribe in Aquitania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:20 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 20 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
sonticus: <entryFree id="n44730" type="main" key="sonti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sontĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sons</etym>. <sense id="n44730.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">dangerous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">critical</hi>, in the connection morbus sonticus, of <hi rend="ital">a serious disorder</hi> that excuses one from duty, etc., Fragm. XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=290" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 290</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:27" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:65" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:1:60" default="NO">42, 1, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:11:2" default="NO">2, 11, 2</bibl>; 5, 1, 46; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 19, 34, § 142</bibl>; Cincius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:4:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 4, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44730.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: sontica causa, arising from a morbus sonticus; hence, in gen., <hi rend="ital">serious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weighty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">important</hi>, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=344" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 344</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0112,001:ib. p. 290" default="NO"><author>Naev.</author> ib. p. 290</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:8:51" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 8, 51</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sontini: <entryFree id="n44731" type="main" key="Sontini"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sontini</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44731.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Lucania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 15, § 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sontius: <entryFree id="n44732" type="main" key="Sonti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sontĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44732.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Carinthia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the Lisonzo</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Ep. 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Jornand.</author> Get. 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sonupes: <entryFree id="n44733" type="main" key="so^nu^pe_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏnŭpēs</orth>, v. sonipes.</entryFree>
sonus: <entryFree id="n44734" type="main" key="so^nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏnus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, in <sense id="n44734.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 4, 14</bibl>; <case>abl.</case> sonu, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 491, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 216, 7</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">nom. plur.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 9, 15</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sono</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a noise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sound</hi> (syn. fragor): et pereunte viro raucum sonus aere cucurrit, Enn. ap. Lact. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:56" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 56</bibl> (Ann. v. 509 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">tympana raucis Obstrepuere sonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:392" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 392</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non exaudito tubae sono,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signorum sonus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 105</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ingenti sono fluminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 28</bibl></cit>: olli respondit suavis sonus Egeriai, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=42" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 42</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 122 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">tantus et tam dulcis sonus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:18:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 18, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">distinctus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 42, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab acutissimo sono usque ad gravissimum sonum,</quote> <trans><tr>from the highest treble to the lowest bass</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Cr. 1, 59, 251</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tibiarum cantibus varietas sonorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:58:146" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 58, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(lingua) sonos vocis distinctos efficit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 59, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad nervorum eliciendos sonos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 60, 150</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:348" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 348</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inpulit aures Confusae sonus urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:619" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 619</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:434" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 434</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 28, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:17:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 17, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inanes sonos fundere,</quote> <trans><tr>to utter empty sounds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:26:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 26, 73</bibl></cit> Kühn.—</sense><sense id="n44734.1" n="II" level="1"> Fig., <hi rend="ital">tone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">character</hi>, <hi rend="ital">style</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et in tragoediā comicum vitiosum est, et in comoediā turpe tragicum, et in ceteris suus est cuique certus sonus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Opt. Gen. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unus enim sonus est totius orationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:26:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 26, 100</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:12:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 12, 54</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44734.2" n="B" level="2"> Of language, <hi rend="ital">sonorousness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravitas et cothurnus et sonus Sophocli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:68" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 68</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n44735" type="main" key="so_nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n44735.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sounding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resounding</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 1, 4, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n44736" type="main" key="So_nus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sōnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sw=nos</foreign>, <sense id="n44736.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of India</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a branch of the Ganges</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 18, 22, § 65</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sopater: <entryFree id="n44737" type="main" key="So_pa^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sōpăter</orth>, <itype>tri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sw/patros</foreign>, <sense id="n44737.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek proper name</hi>, e. g. <hi rend="ital">a victim of Verres</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Halicyensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:28:section=68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 28, § 68</bibl></cit>.—Another, <hi rend="ital">a witness against Verres</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:39:section=85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 39, § 85</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sophene: <entryFree id="n44738" type="main" key="So_phe_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sōphēnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*swfhnh/</foreign>, <sense id="n44738.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a district in Armenia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:11" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:592" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 592</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 12, 13, § 66</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sopheni: <entryFree id="n44739" type="main" key="So_phe_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sōphēni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44739.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Asia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 9, 10, § 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sophia: <entryFree id="n44740" type="greek" key="so^phi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏphĭa</orth> (i long, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Sym. 122</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cath. 1613</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Fortun.</author> Suppl. 2, 62</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sofi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n44740.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wisdom</hi> (pure Lat. sapientia): sophiam, sapientia quae perhibetur, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=325" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 325</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 227 Vahl.); Afran. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:8:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 8, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:112:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 112, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 89:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 89, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 16, 10</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:43:153" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 43, 153</bibl>, written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
sophisma: <entryFree id="n44741" type="greek" key="so^phisma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏphisma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">so/fisma</foreign>, <sense id="n44741.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a false conclusion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fallacy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sophism</hi> (pure Lat. captio), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 45:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 45, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:13:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 13, 2</bibl> (in <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 24, 75</bibl>, written as Greek, and explained by fallaces conclusiunculae; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 111:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 111, 1</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
sophismatius: <entryFree id="n44742" type="main" key="so^phisma^ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏphismătĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sophisma</etym>, <sense id="n44742.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sophistical</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dialecticus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 13</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sophistes: <entryFree id="n44743" type="greek" key="so^phistes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏphistes</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏphista</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <cb n="SOPI" /> <foreign lang="greek">sofisth/s</foreign>, <sense id="n44743.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sophist</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis hic est? num sophistes? sic enim appellabantur hi, qui ostentationis aut quaestus causā philosophabantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 23, 72</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:11:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 11, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Protagoras, sophistes maximus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:23:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 23, 63</bibl></cit>.—Form sophista, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:5:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 5, 3</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">voc.</hi>: insulse sophista, Lucil. ap. Don. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sophistice: <entryFree id="n44744" type="main" key="so^phisti^ce_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏphistĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. sophisticus <sense id="n44744.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n44745" type="main" key="so^phisti^ce_2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏphistĭcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sofistikh/</foreign> (<foreign lang="greek">te/xnh</foreign>), <sense id="n44745.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">false reasoning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sophistry</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 2, p. 17, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sophisticus: <entryFree id="n44746" type="greek" key="so^phisti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏphistĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">sofistiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n44746.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sophistic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sophistical;</hi> res admodum insidiosa et sophistica, neque ad veritates magis quam ad captiones reperta, Tiro Tullius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3:35" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 3, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">captio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:2:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostentatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut concidant sophistica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 2, 41</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏphi-stĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">sophistically</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">interpretari legem et cavillari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 8, 10, 12, § 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 37, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sophocles: <entryFree id="n44747" type="main" key="So^pho^cles"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŏphŏcles</orth>, <itype>is and i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sofoklh=s</foreign>, <sense id="n44747.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated Greek tragic poet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:7:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 7, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:25:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 25, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:40:144" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 40, 144</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 163</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:67 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 67 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:2:17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:16:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 16, 3</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> Sophocli, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:11:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 11, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:18:3" default="NO">13, 18, 3</bibl>; <case>voc.</case> Sophocle (like Socrate), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:40:144" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 40, 144</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŏphō^clēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in the manner of Sophocles</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">an pangis aliquid Sophocleum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cothurnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:15:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 15, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sophoclidisca: <entryFree id="n44748" type="main" key="So^pho_^cli^disca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŏphō^clĭdisca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n44748.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a woman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sophoniba: <entryFree id="n44749" type="main" key="So^pho^ni_ba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŏphŏnība</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n44749.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wife of Syphax and daughter of Hasdrubal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:12:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 12, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 15, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sophos: <entryFree id="n44750" type="greek" key="so^phos1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏphos</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏphus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sofo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n44750.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wise man</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">te sophos omnis amat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:32:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 32, 4</bibl></cit>.—Adjectively, <hi rend="ital">wise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shrewd</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">victor sophus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:14:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 14, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">factus periclo tum gubernator sophus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:15:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 15, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n44751" type="greek" key="so^pho_s2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏphōs</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">sofw=s</foreign>, an exclamation of applause, <sense id="n44751.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">well done! well said! bravo!</hi> (not ante-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">Cic. has, instead of it, bene!): at tibi tergeminum mugiet ille sophos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:46:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 46, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:50:37" default="NO">1, 50, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:67:4" default="NO">1, 67, 4</bibl>; 1, 77, 10; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 40, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 13</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in carm.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sophron: <entryFree id="n44752" type="main" key="So_phron"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sōphron</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sw/frwn</foreign>, <sense id="n44752.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek composer of mimes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=179" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 179</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sophrona: <entryFree id="n44753" type="main" key="So_phro^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sōphrŏna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n44753.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a woman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nurse of Pamphila</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sophroniscus: <entryFree id="n44754" type="main" key="So_phroniscus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sōphroniscus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*swfroni/skos</foreign>, <sense id="n44754.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a statuary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the father of Socrates</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 4</bibl>, ext. 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:32:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 32, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sophus: <entryFree id="n44755" type="main" key="so^phus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏphus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. 1. sophos.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n44756" type="main" key="So^phus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŏphus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. sophos</etym>, <sense id="n44756.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname of the consul P. Sempronius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:45:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 45, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 9, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sopio: <entryFree id="n44757" type="main" key="so_pio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōpio</orth>, <itype>īvi or ĭi, ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>sopor</etym>, <sense id="n44757.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to deprive of feeling</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sense;</hi> esp. by sleep, <hi rend="ital">to put</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lull to sleep.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44757.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.; most freq. in <hi rend="ital">part. perf.;</hi> in Cic. only so; cf. sedo): impactus ita est saxo, ut sopiretur, <hi rend="ital">became unconscious</hi> or <hi rend="ital">senseless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">was stunned</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 16, 25, § 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vino oneratos sopire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:46" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 46</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:19" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 149</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 213</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: castoreo gravi mulier sopita recumbit, Lucr b, 794; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sopitum vulnere ac nihil sentientem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem vigilantem sic eluseritis, sopitum oportet fallatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:35:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 35, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delphinus sopitus odoris novitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 8, 8, § 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sopito corpore ipse (animus) vigilet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:51:115" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 51, 115</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 29, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:9" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 9</bibl> (opp. vigiles); 31, 23; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 87, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:431" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 431</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:920" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 920</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:471" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 471</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 317</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:642" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 642</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:367" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 367</bibl>: sopitae quietis tempus, <hi rend="ital">of deep</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sound sleep</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 37</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44757.2" n="B" level="2"> In the poets, pregn., <hi rend="ital">to lay to rest</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to kill</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem fundā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:153" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 153</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be laid to rest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to die</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Homerus) sceptra potitus, eādem aliis sopitu' quiete est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1038" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1038</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:ib. 3:904" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 904</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44757.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things concr. and abstr., <hi rend="ital">to lull to sleep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">lay at rest; to calm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">settle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">still</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quiet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">venti sopiuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 48, § 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sopito mari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 79, 81, § 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sopitos suscitat ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:743" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 743</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 410</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aras excitat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 542</bibl></cit>: draconis saevi sopivi impetum, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 252</bibl> P. (Trag. v. 314 Vahl.): haec omnia veteris imperatoris maturitas<pb n="1731" /> <cb n="SORA" />  brevi sopiit ac sustulit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:125:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 125, 3</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (blandimentis) sopita virtus coniveret,</quote> <trans><tr>lulled to sleep</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:17:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 17, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munera militiaï,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furor armorum ubique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:89:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 89, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium pecudis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:37:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 37, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloria vitiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 1</bibl></cit>, ext. 1: <cit><quote lang="la">artes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Mall. Theod. 264</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sopolis: <entryFree id="n44758" type="main" key="Sopolis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sopolis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44758.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated painter in the time of Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 16</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Sopolin, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 148</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sopor: <entryFree id="n44759" type="main" key="so^por"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏpor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. root svap-, sleep; cf. somnus; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">u(/pnos</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n44759.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a deep sleep.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44759.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">sleep</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; not in Cic.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">somnus): lucrum praeposivi sopori et quieti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum eum cibo vinoque gravatum sopor oppressisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sopore discusso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:8:22" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 8, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:10:13" default="NO">6, 10, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:11:18" default="NO">7, 11, 18</bibl>; 8, 6, 26; <cit><quote lang="la">but also opp. somnus: hujus (junci) semine somnum allici, sed modum servandum, ne sopor fiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 18, 71, § 119</bibl></cit>: sopore placans artus languidos, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:22:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 22, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum suavi devinxit membra sopore Somnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:453" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 453</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:765" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 765</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:996" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 996</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox erat et placidum carpebant fessa soporem Corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:522" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 522</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piger his labante languore oculos sopor operit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fessos sopor inrigat artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:511" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 511</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">placidum petivit soporem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 406</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occupet ut fessi lumina victa sopor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>. —Personified, Sopor = Somnus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:278" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 278</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:3:45" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 3, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:308" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 308</bibl>. —In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:4:9" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 4, 9</bibl> (Müll. sapores).—</sense><sense id="n44759.2" n="2" level="3"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">the sleep of death</hi>, <hi rend="ital">death</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in soporem conlocastis nudos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 148</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 150</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeternus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:466" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 466</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpetuus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 24, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44759.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44759.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Stupefaction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lethargy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupor</hi>: neque dormire excitatus, neque vigilare ebrius poterat, sed semisomno sopore ... jactabatur, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:124" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 124</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">temulento sopore profligatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> § 123.—</sense><sense id="n44759.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Drowsiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">laziness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indifference</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sopor et ignavia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:42:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 42, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44759.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Poppy-juice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opium</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">e nigro papavere sopor gignitur scapo inciso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 18, 76, § 198</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44759.7" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A sleepingdraught</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sleeping - potion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sopore sumpto dormiturus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 83:25" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 83, 25</bibl></cit>; so (opp. venenum) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:13:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 5, 13, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:5:12" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 5, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 2, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44759.8" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The temple</hi> (of the head; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Germ. Schläfe): laevus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:3:29" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 3, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
soporatio: <entryFree id="n44760" type="main" key="so^po_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏpōrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n44760.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lethargy</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 3, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
soporatus: <entryFree id="n44761" type="main" key="so^po_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏpōrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. soporo.</entryFree>
soporifer: <entryFree id="n44762" type="main" key="so^po_ri^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏpōrĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sopor-fero</etym>, <sense id="n44762.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sleep-bringing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inducing sleep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sleepy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drowsy</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">papaver,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:486" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 486</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lac,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 38, § 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis pinnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 13, 15, § 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus (trychni),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 31, 105, § 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aula Somni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:586" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 586</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:287" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 287</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Petr. poët. 128, 6, 1: Lethe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:1:47" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vices,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 404</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
soporo: <entryFree id="n44763" type="main" key="so^po_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏpōro</orth>, no <sense id="n44763.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>sopor</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to put</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lay asleep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cast into sleep; to deprive of sense</hi> or <hi rend="ital">feeling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stupefy</hi> (not ante-Aug.; usu. in <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>). </sense><sense id="n44763.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si saepius expergiscitur aliquis quam assuevit, deinde iterum soporatur,</quote> <trans><tr>falls asleep</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opium mentem soporat sensusque abalienat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 180" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpentes soporari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 8, 29, § 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut soporetur illa sopore enecans vis earum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 31, 105, § 182</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">soporatos hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquatilia quiete placida ceu soporata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 75, 97, § 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soporatos artus premit alta quies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:334" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 334</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vellera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:238" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 238</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 3, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44763.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, with an inanim. or abstr. object, <hi rend="ital">to lay at rest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to still</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allay</hi> (syn. sopire): <cit><quote lang="la">multo Imbre rogum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:235" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 235</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soporatus dolor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:1:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 1, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44763.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To render soporific</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ramus Vi soporatus Stygia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:855" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 855</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 420</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 1, 284</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
soporus: <entryFree id="n44764" type="main" key="so^po_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏpōrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <sense id="n44764.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to sleep</hi>, i. e., </sense><sense id="n44764.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Sleep-bringing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">causing sleep</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:390" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 390</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 236</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:403" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 403</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">soporae pennae (Somni),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:354" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 354</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis, i. e. Lethe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:856" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 856</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44764.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Heavy with sleep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drowsy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dozy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dapibus vinoque soporus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:222" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 222</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sora: <entryFree id="n44765" type="main" key="So_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sōra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n44765.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the northernmost city of</hi> <cb n="SORD" /> <hi rend="ital">the Volsci in Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Arpinum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Liris</hi>, still called <hi rend="ital">Sora</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 23</bibl> sq.; 10, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:14:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 14, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:396" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 396</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:223" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 223</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sōrānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Sora</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Soran</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transfuga,</quote> <trans><tr>from Sora</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Q. Varerius Soranus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:11:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 11, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:46:169" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 46, 169</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">augur (jestingly, on account of the superstitious character of the Sorans),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 47</bibl></cit>: COLONIA, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Sora</hi> (<hi rend="ital">as a Roman colony</hi>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3681</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
soracte: <entryFree id="n44766" type="main" key="So_racte"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sōracte</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Sauracte</orth>), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. svar, heaven; cf.: serenus, 2. Soranus</etym>, <sense id="n44766.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a high mountain in Etruria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on which was a temple of Apollo</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Monte S. Oreste</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:3:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 93, 95, § 207</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:696" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 696</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 785</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:662" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 662</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:494 al" default="NO">8, 494 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Masc.</hi> collat. form: <cit><quote lang="la">ad montem Soractem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
soractia: <entryFree id="n44767" type="main" key="Soracti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Soractĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n44767.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Syria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">founded by Semiramis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 28, 32, § 145</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
soracum: <entryFree id="n44768" type="greek" key="so_ra^cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōrăcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sw/rakos</foreign>,, <sense id="n44768.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pannier</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hamper</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 1, 64</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=297" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 297</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
soranus: <entryFree id="n44769" type="main" key="So_ra_nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sōrānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Sora.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n44770" type="gloss" key="Soranus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Soranus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44770.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an epithet of</hi> Dis, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 11, 785</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sorbeo: <entryFree id="n44771" type="main" key="sorbe^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sorbĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 2</itype> (collat. forms: <sense id="n44771.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pres. subj.</hi> sorbamus, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 119</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> sorpsi, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 217</bibl>, and <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 363</bibl>; cf. the compounds), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>akin with Gr. <foreign lang="greek">r(ofe/w</foreign>; cf. O. H. Germ. swarb, swirbil, whirlpool</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to sup up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suck in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drink down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swallow</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n44771.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. haurio): hominum sanguinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calidum sanguinem ex homine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 1, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crudum ovum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 3, 11, § 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:843" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 843</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">margaritas aceto liquefactas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 37</bibl></cit> et saep.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sorbet dormiens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:6 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 6 sq.</bibl></cit>—Prov.: simul flare sorbereque haud facile, <hi rend="ital">to drink and whistle at the same time</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to do two things at once</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 104</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44771.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to suck in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draw in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swallow up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">absorb</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1130</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Charybdis vastos) Sorbet in abruptum fluctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:422" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 422</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fretum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sorbent avidae praecordia flammae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:172" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(quae sorbuit terrae hiatus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 80, 82, § 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minus sorbet politura charta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 12, 25, § 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā sorbeat aëra sannā Tullia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:306" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 306</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44771.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to swallow down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brook</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid eum non sorbere animo, quid non haurire cogitatione, cuius sanguinem non bibere censetis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odia (corresp. to concoquere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 9, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sorbilis: <entryFree id="n44772" type="main" key="sorbi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sorbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sorbeo</etym>, <sense id="n44772.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be sucked</hi> or <hi rend="ital">supped up</hi> (not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ovum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 18 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 33, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibi, ut recens caseus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sorbillo: <entryFree id="n44773" type="main" key="sorbillo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sorbillo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n44773.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dim. a.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to sip</hi> (ante- and post-class.). </sense><sense id="n44773.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cyathos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum dulciter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 121, 36</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n44773.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sorbillantibus saviis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 135, 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sorbilo: <entryFree id="n44774" type="main" key="sorbi^lo_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sorbĭlō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n44774.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sippingly;</hi> hence, transf., <hi rend="ital">drop by drop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bit by bit</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">victitare,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>poorly</tr>, <tr>sparely</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 185</bibl></cit>: senectutem ducat usque ad senium sorbilo, Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=339" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 339</bibl> Müll. (Com. Rel. v. 73 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
sorbitio: <entryFree id="n44775" type="main" key="sorbi^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sorbĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sorbeo; a supping up, swallowing, drinking; hence, concr.</etym>, <sense id="n44775.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drink</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draught</hi>, <hi rend="ital">potion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">broth</hi>, etc. (mostly post-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:10:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 16, 62, § 170</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:188" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 19, 120, § 188</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:26:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 26, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 78:25" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 78, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sorbitio quem tollit dira cicutae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Socrates</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:2" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sorbitium: <entryFree id="n44776" type="hapax" key="sorbi^ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sorbĭtĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, = sorbitio, <sense id="n44776.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drink</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draught</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 21, 360</bibl> dub. (al. sorbitio).</sense></entryFree>
sorbitiuncula: <entryFree id="n44777" type="main" key="sorbi^ti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sorbĭtĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>sorbitio</etym>, <sense id="n44777.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small draught</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 10 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Vit. Hilar. 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 13, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sorbum: <entryFree id="n44778" type="main" key="sorbum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sorbum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sorbus</etym>, <sense id="n44778.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the fruit of the</hi> sorbus, <hi rend="ital">a sorb - apple</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sorb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">service - berry</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 21, 23, § 85</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 7, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:59:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 59, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:16:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 16, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:380" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 380</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sorbus: <entryFree id="n44779" type="main" key="sorbus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sorbus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n44779.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the true sorb-</hi> or <hi rend="ital">servicetree</hi>: Sorbus domestica, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:19" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 18, 30, § 74</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jan. 15, 1 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
sordeo: <entryFree id="n44780" type="main" key="sorde^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sordĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>cf. Goth. svarts; Germ. schwarz, black</etym>, <sense id="n44780.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be dirty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filthy</hi>, <cb n="SORD" /> <hi rend="ital">foul</hi> (rare; not in Cic.; syn. squaleo). </sense><sense id="n44780.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <hi rend="ital">Di.</hi> Jam lavisti? <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Num tibi sordere videor? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 28</bibl>: cui manus materno sordet sparsa sanguine, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 170, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non splendeat toga: ne sordeat quidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 5:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullā teneri lanugine vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:32:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 32, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Albanoque cadum sordentem promere fumo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:8:39" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 8, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incola sordentium ganearum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:2:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44780.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be mean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">base</hi>, <hi rend="ital">low</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">sordid</hi>: haud sordere visus est Festus dies, i. e. <hi rend="ital">had nothing mean</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sordid in its appearance</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 6</bibl>: convivium inopiā, Favor. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:8:20" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 8, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignobilia et sordentia (verba),</quote> <trans><tr>low</tr>, <tr>vulgar</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:13:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 13, 3</bibl></cit> (shortly before, sordidum verbum).—</sense><sense id="n44780.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to seem base</hi> or <hi rend="ital">paltry; to be despised</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slighted</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">held of no account</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suis sordere (with contemni),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:25:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 25, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">26: sordent tibi munera nostra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:3:98" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 3, 98</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cunctane prae campo sordent?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pretium aetas altera sordet,</quote> <trans><tr>a renewal of youth seems too small a price</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 18, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quippe sordent prima quaeque, cum majora sperantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:10:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 10, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si conferas et componas Graeca ipsa, oppido quam jacere atque sordere incipiunt, quae Latina sunt,</quote> <trans><tr>to seem paltry</tr>, <tr>of small account</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:23:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 23, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sordes: <entryFree id="n44781" type="main" key="sordes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sordes</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<case>abl.</case> sordi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1271" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1271</bibl>; usu. sorde), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sordeo</etym>, <sense id="n44781.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dirt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncleanness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">squalor</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in a trop. sense, and in <number>plur.</number>; syn.: situs, squalor, caenum, illuvies). </sense><sense id="n44781.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44781.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pleni sordium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:104 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 104 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sordibus aurium inhaerescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:57:144" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 57, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sint sine sordibus ungues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:519" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 519</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caret obsoleti Sordibus tecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 10, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 26, 65, § 191</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44781.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam in medio oculo paulum sordi'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auriculae collectā sorde dolentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(pellis) Ulceribus tetris prope jam sordique sepultā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1271" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1271</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44781.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">a mourning garment</hi> (because usu. soiled or dirty); and hence, <hi rend="ital">mourning</hi> in gen. (syn. squalor): <cit><quote lang="la">jacere in lacrimis et sordibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in sordibus, lamentis, luctuque jacuisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:36:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 36, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mater squalore hujus et sordibus laetatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 6, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">67, 192</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:40:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 40, 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sordes lugubres vobis erant jucundae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:23:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 23, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suscipere sordes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:8:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 8, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44781.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">lowness</hi> or <hi rend="ital">meanness of rank</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a low condition; meanness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">baseness</hi> of behavior or disposition (syn. illiberalitas). </sense><sense id="n44781.6" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">sordes fortunae et vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:62:224" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 62, 224</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obscuritas et sordes tuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 5, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:28:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 28, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quisque sordidissimus videbitur, ita libentissime severitate judicandi sordes suas eluet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla nota, nullus color, nullae sordes videbantur his sententiis allini posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in infamiā relinqui ac sordibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 16, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sordes illae verborum,</quote> <trans><tr>low</tr>, <tr>vulgar expressions</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter maternas sordes,</quote> <trans><tr>low origin</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:2:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pristinarum sordium oblitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:25:1:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 25, 1, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:7:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 18, 7, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44781.7" n="2" level="3"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">the dregs of the people</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the mob</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rabble</hi> (syn. faex): <cit><quote lang="la">apud sordem urbis et faecem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 11</bibl></cit>; so (with caenum) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:29:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 29, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sordes et obscuritatem Vitellianarum partium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 84</bibl></cit>.—Hence, as a term of abuse: <cit><quote lang="la">o lutum, o sordes!</quote> <trans><tr>low-minded creature</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:26:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 26, 62</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44781.8" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">meanness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stinginess</hi>, <hi rend="ital">niggardliness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sordidness</hi> (cf.: parcimonia, avaritia). </sense><sense id="n44781.9" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(populus Romanus) non amat profusas epulas, sordes et inhumanitatem multo minus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:36:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 36, 76</bibl></cit>; so (opp. luxuria) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 6, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">damnatus sordium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 2:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incusare alicujus sordes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:74" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sordes obicere alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 68</bibl></cit> and 107: <cit><quote lang="la">sepulcrum sine sordibus exstrue,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogit minimas ediscere sordes,</quote> <trans><tr>the meanest tricks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14</bibl></cit> 124; 1, 140.—</sense><sense id="n44781.10" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum hujus in privatis rebus factum avarum, nullam in re familiari sordem posse proferri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 3, 7</bibl></cit>; so (with avaritia) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 52</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">extremae avaritiae et sordis infimae infamis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 112, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sordesco: <entryFree id="n44782" type="main" key="sordesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sordesco</orth>, <itype>dŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n44782.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [sordeo], <hi rend="ital">to become dirty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grow filthy</hi> (not ante-Aug., and very rare): contrectatus ubi manibus sordescere vulgi Coeperis (liber), * <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep 1</bibl>, <pb n="1732" /> <cb n="SORD" /> 20, 11: <cit><quote lang="la">mel,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 12, 12, § 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 3, 19, § 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to become wild</tr>, <tr>lie untilled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:12:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 12, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44782.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be mean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vile</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 13, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sordicula: <entryFree id="n44783" type="main" key="sordi^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sordĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>sordes</etym>, <sense id="n44783.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little dirt</hi> or <hi rend="ital">filth</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 8, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sordidatus: <entryFree id="n44784" type="main" key="sordi^da_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sordĭdātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sordidus; cf.: albatus, atratus, from albus, ater, etc.</etym>, <sense id="n44784.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in dirty clothes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meanly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shabbily dressed.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44784.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44784.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: quamquam ego sum sordidatus, frugi tamen sum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 90</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sordidata et sordida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 56</bibl></cit> (shortly before: <cit><quote lang="la">pannis obsita): servi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:27:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 27, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mancipia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:29:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 29, 73</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44784.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp., as a sign of mourning (when a person had lost friends by death, was under accusation, or in distress from any cause): <cit><quote lang="la">sensi magno opere moveri judices, cum excitavi maestum ac sordidatum senem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:47:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 47, 195</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:41:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 41, 99</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">reus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:34" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Virginius sordidatus filiam suam obsoletā veste in forum deducit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expulsi bonis omnibus Romam venerunt, sordidati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:25:section=62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 25, § 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba Aetolorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primo diluculo sordidatus descendit ad rostra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 15</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n44784.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">foul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">polluted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sordidatissima conscientia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
sordide: <entryFree id="n44785" type="main" key="sordi^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sordĭdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. sordidus <sense id="n44785.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sordido: <entryFree id="n44786" type="main" key="sordi^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sordĭdo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>sordidus</etym>, <sense id="n44786.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to dirty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pollute</hi> (late Lat.). </sense><sense id="n44786.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram moto pulvere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 23, 347</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n44786.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: templum cordis malis cogitationibus, Lact. de Ira Dei, 23, 28; 5, 19, 34; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 800</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
sordidulus: <entryFree id="n44787" type="main" key="sordi^du^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sordĭdŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n44787.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [id.]. * </sense><sense id="n44787.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">soiled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smutched</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">toga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:149" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 149</bibl></cit>. —* </sense><sense id="n44787.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">low</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vile</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">servuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 58</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sordidus: <entryFree id="n44788" type="main" key="sordi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sordĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sordeo</etym>, <sense id="n44788.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dirty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unclean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filthy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">squalid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sordid</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n44788.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (syn.: squalidus, obscenus): vestem squalam et sordidam, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 504, 6</bibl> (Trag. v. 370 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">amictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 301</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sordidior toga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:104:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 104, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mappa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:20:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 20, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:11:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 11, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at pol nitent, haud sordidae videntur ambae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servolicolae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:18:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 18, 28</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">magnos duces Non indecoro pulvere sordidos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer sordidissimus dentibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 64, 6</bibl></cit> et saep.—Esp.: <cit><quote lang="la">sordido in loco sedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:13:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 13, 2</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of mourners, <hi rend="ital">clad in mourning</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:40:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 40, 86</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Auctumnus calcatis sordidus uvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 29</bibl></cit>;
