<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:897" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 897</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Col. poët. 10, 44: terga suis,</quote> <trans><tr>sooty</tr>, <tr>dingy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:648" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 648</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: saepe est etiam sub palliolo sordido sapientia, <hi rend="ital">wisdom is often hid under a ragged cloak</hi>, Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:23:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 23, 56</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44788.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">low</hi>, <hi rend="ital">base</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mean</hi>, as to birth, rank, or condition; <hi rend="ital">poor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">humble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">small</hi>, <hi rend="ital">paltry</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">illiberalis, infimus): causam commisisse homini egenti, sordido, sine honore, sme censu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 22, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:16:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 16, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 28, 14</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sordidissimus quisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:47:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 47, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiae sordidissima pars,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 132, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">loco non humili solum sed etiam sordido ortus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:25:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 25, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a sordidis initiis ad summa crevere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:6:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sordidum et obscurum Macedonum nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:9:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 22, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">panis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 2, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 18:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 18, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">villula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 27, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">tecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:396" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 396</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lar villae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:57:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 57, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rura (with humiles casae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aratra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 414</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence also, otia, i. e. ruris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:56:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 56, 4</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n44788.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">low</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">base</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abject</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">despicable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disgraceful</hi> (syn. turpis). </sense><sense id="n44788.4" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 8, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">iste omnium turpissimus et sordidissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multo homo sordidissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,029:2:section=23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Scaur. 2, § 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo furiosus ac sordidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:6:section=19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 6, § 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec minus laetabor, cum te semper sordidum, quam si paulisper sordidatum viderem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:41:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 41, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illiberales et sordidi quaestus mercenariorum omnium, quorum operae, non quorum artes emuntur ... Sordidi etiam putandi, qui mercantur a mercatoribus, quod statim vendant, etc.... Opifices omnes in sordidā arte versantur, etc.... mercatura autem, si tenuis est, sordida putanda est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:42:150" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 42, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:16 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 16 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf.: sordidissima ratio et inquinatissima,<cb n="SORO" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:6:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 6, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (oratores) ne sordidiores quidem (artis) repudiarint (opp. praeclarissimas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:32:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 32, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus repulsae nescia sordidae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulterium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:49" default="NO">8, 3, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:10" default="NO">2, 5, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:12:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 12, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia, id 10, 1, 9: homines nullā re bonā dignos, cum quibus comparari sordidum, confligere autem miserum et periculosum sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:5:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 5, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:14:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 14, 50</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui pecuniam praeferre amicitiae sordidum existiment,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:17:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 17, 63</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44788.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">mean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">niggardly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">penurious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sordid</hi> (cf. parcus): <cit><quote lang="la">ita sordidus, ut se Non umquam servo melius vestiret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 96</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 65</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 10</bibl>; 2, 3, 164; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 6, 1</bibl> (opp. sumptuosus): <cit><quote lang="la">perjurium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:19:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 19, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 16, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:42:150" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 42, 150</bibl> supra.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sordĭdē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n44788.6" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">dirtily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foully</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per plateas tractus est sordidissime,</quote> <trans><tr>through the deepest mire</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 33 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n44788.7" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">meanly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">basely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo sordidius et abjectius nati sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44788.8" n="3" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44788.9" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Vulgarly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unbecomingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poorly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loquitur laute et minime sordide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:83:339" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 83, 339</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contionari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">declamare (opp. splendide atque ornate),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Rhet. 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:4:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 4, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44788.10" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Meanly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stingily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">penuriously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sordidly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis illum sordide Simonidi dixisse, se dimidium ejus ei, quod pactus esset, pro illo carmine daturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:86:352" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 86, 352</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere aliquid (opp. largissime),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gerere proconsulatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 9, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sordities: <entryFree id="n44789" type="main" key="sordi^ti^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sordĭtĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sordes</etym>, <sense id="n44789.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">filth</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 2, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sorditudo: <entryFree id="n44790" type="hapax" key="sordi^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sordĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n44790.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dirt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sordones: <entryFree id="n44791" type="main" key="Sordones"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sordones</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44791.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Gaul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">towards the Pyrenees</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 4, 5, § 32</bibl> Jan. (al. Sardones); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
sordulentus: <entryFree id="n44792" type="hapax" key="sordu^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sordŭlentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sordes</etym>, <sense id="n44792.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wearing dirty clothes</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Poen. 11 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
sorex: <entryFree id="n44793" type="main" key="so_^rex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sō^rex</orth> (o long, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 4, 57</bibl>; Poët. in Anthol. Burm. 2, p. 452; o short, Auct. Carm. Phil. 62; Poët. in Anthol. Burm. 2, p. 453), <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">u(/rac</foreign>; root svar-; cf. susurrus</etym>, <sense id="n44793.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shrew-mouse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 6, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:12" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 41, 41, § 109</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">its noise was of ill omen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 57, 82, § 223</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:1:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 1, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
soricaria: <entryFree id="n44794" type="main" key="So_ri^ca_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sōrĭcārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n44794.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of</hi> Hispania Baetica, Auct. B. Hisp. 27.</sense></entryFree>
soricinus: <entryFree id="n44795" type="hapax" key="so_ri^ci_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōrĭcīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sorex</etym>, <sense id="n44795.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the shrew-mouse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 48</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sorites: <entryFree id="n44796" type="greek" key="so_ri_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōrītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<sense id="n44796.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">acc. sing.</hi> soritam, Cic. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 329, 20</bibl> dub.), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">swrei/ths</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a logical sophism formed by an accumulation of arguments</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a</hi> sorites (pure Lat. acervus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:4:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 4, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 16, 49</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 33, 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:19:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 19, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sorix: <entryFree id="n44797" type="gloss" key="sorix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sorix</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">savrix</orth>, <itype>avis tributa Saturno ab auguribus</itype>, etc., Marc. Vict. p. 2470 P.</entryFree>
soror: <entryFree id="n44798" type="main" key="so^ror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏror</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. svasar; Goth. svister; Germ. Schwester; Engl. sister</etym>. <sense id="n44798.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44798.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a sister: Th.</hi> Salve, mea soror. <hi rend="ital">Pl.</hi> Frater mi, salve, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 2, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:68 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 68 sq.</bibl>: germana soror, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:20:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 20, 40</bibl> (Ann. v. 42 Vahl.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mea soror gemina germana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:30 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 30 sq.</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">germana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:27:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 27, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jovis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Juno</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:266" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 266</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:27 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 27 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phoebi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Luna</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 11, 45</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:110" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 110</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agnam Aeneas matri Eumenidum magnaeque sorori ferit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to Nox and Terra</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 250</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doctae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Muses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:45" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 255</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also sorores novem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:12:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 12, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genitae Nocte,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Furies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:451" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 451</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also crinitae angue sorores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:349" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 349</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, vipereae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:662" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 662</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Fates</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:3:35" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 3, 35</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also sorores tres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:13:44" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 13, 44</bibl></cit> (3, 5, 28); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 3, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:808" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 808</bibl>.—Of beasts: <cit><quote lang="la">in grege prioris anni sororem equa comitatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 42, 64, § 156</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">bonae mentis soror est paupertas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 84, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44798.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sorores,</quote> <trans><tr>the Muses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 1, 17; <hi rend="ital">the Fates</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:326" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 326</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:54:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 54, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:73:3" default="NO">4, 73, 3</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">the Danaides</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 7, 67; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 14, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44798.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n44798.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A cousin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the daughter of a father's brother</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:351" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 351</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44798.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A female friend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">playmate</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">companion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:321" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 321</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 823</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3</bibl>, <cb n="SORS" /> 1, 26; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 611" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 611</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 127</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:4:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:20:2" default="NO">12, 20, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Inscr. Marin. Iscriz. Alb. p. 60.—In eccl. Lat.,</quote> <trans><tr>female Christians</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, Tim. 5, 2.—</sense><sense id="n44798.6" n="C" level="2"> Of things in pairs, connected together, or alike: <cit><quote lang="la">obsecro te hanc per dexteram Perque hanc sororem laevam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of the hand,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> M. 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abjunctae comae mea fata sorores Lugebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 66, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapore caryotarum sorores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 9, § 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:128:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 128, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44798.7" n="D" level="2"> Of the word soror: <cit><quote lang="la">scripta soror fuerat: visum est delere sororem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:528" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 528</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sororcula: <entryFree id="n44799" type="hapax" key="so^rorcu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏrorcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>soror</etym>, <sense id="n44799.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little sister</hi>: germana mea, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 612</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
sororicida: <entryFree id="n44800" type="hapax" key="so^ro_ri^ci_da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏrōrĭ-cīda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>soror-caedo</etym>, <sense id="n44800.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the murderer of his sister</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 10, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sororicidium: <entryFree id="n44801" type="gloss" key="so^ro_ri^ci_di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏrōrĭcīdĭum</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">a)delfoktoni/a</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</entryFree>
sororiculatus: <entryFree id="n44802" type="hapax" key="so^ro_ri^cu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏrōrĭcŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: <sense id="n44802.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">vestis, acc. to Böttig. Vasengemälde, 3, 191: orbiculata,</quote> <trans><tr>with circle-shaped spots</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 48, 74, § 195</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sororio: <entryFree id="n44803" type="main" key="so^ro_ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏrōrĭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>soror</etym>, of the female breasts, <sense id="n44803.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to grow up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">swell together</hi>, like two sisters: papillae sororiabant, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=297" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 297</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">mammae sororiantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 6, 33, § 66</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sororius: <entryFree id="n44804" type="main" key="so^ro_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏrōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n44804.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a sister</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sisterly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cena,</quote> <trans><tr>made because a sister was found</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 2, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stupra,</quote> <trans><tr>with a sister</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of Dido</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:559" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 559</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oscula,</quote> <trans><tr>as a sister gives to a brother</tr>, <tr>sisterly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:334" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 334</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 539</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44804.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic.: Sororium Tigillum, <hi rend="ital">the Sister's beam</hi>, a place in Rome sacred to Juno, where Horatius was obliged to creep under a beam laid across the way as a punishment for having killed his sister, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 26, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 4" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 4</bibl>; Fest. pp. 297 and 307 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
sors: <entryFree id="n44805" type="main" key="sors"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sors</orth>, <itype>tis</itype> (<case>nom.</case> sortis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 28</bibl>; <case>abl.</case> sorti. C. I. L. 198, 54; 200, 16; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 7, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:37:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 37, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:45:11" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 45, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 20, 4</bibl>; cf. Neue, Formenl. 1, 241; but sorti is <case>dat.</case>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 165</bibl> Forbig. ad loc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:3:65" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 3, 65</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. sero; cf.: fors, fero</etym>, any thing used to determine chances. <sense id="n44805.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a lot</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut populna sors aut abiegna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coniciam sortes in sitellam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 34</bibl></cit> sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">tot in hydriam sortes conicerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:51:section=127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 51, § 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponere in sitellam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 18, 8</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and simply conicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:34 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 34 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 7, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:490" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 490</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum dejecta in id sors esset,</quote> <trans><tr>lots were cast for it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:41:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 41, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 41, 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:64:section=143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 64, § 143</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum de consularibus mea prima sors exisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 19, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut cujusque sors exciderat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:42:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 42, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sortem in sitellam latam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 18, 8</bibl></cit> Weissenb.: <cit><quote lang="la">et Caere sortes extenuatas (creditum est), as an omen of ill,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:62:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 62, 5</bibl></cit> and 8: <cit><quote lang="la">sortes suā sponte adtenuatas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">chances</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tickets</hi> in a lottery, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:75" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 75 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n44805.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44805.2" n="A" level="2"> Abstr., <hi rend="ital">a casting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">drawing of lots</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decision by lot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lot</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestor quem sors dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:3:section=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 3, § 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res revocatur ad sortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:51:section=127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 51, § 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sorti sum victus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ei sorte provincia Sicilia obvenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:6:section=17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 6, § 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cui Sicilia provincia sorte evenisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 20</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: cui ea provincia sorti evenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:37:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 37, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Q. Caecilio sorte evenit, ut in Bruttiis adversum Hannibalem bellum gereret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:45:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 45, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sorte ductus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:34:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 34, 51</bibl></cit>; Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 2, 201</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sorte ducti e primoribus civitatis unus et viginti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 29</bibl>: sorte in provinciam proficisci, S. C. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 8, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sorte agros legionibus assignare, Brut. ib., 11, 20, 3 et saep.: de se ter sortibus consultum dicebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 53 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jubet extra sortem Theomnastum renuntiari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:51:section=127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 51, § 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extra sortem agrum Campanum dividere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 20</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n44805.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A lot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">share</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the duty assigned by lot</hi>, esp. of the prætors, who divided by lot the duties of their office: <cit><quote lang="la">praetores, Q. Fulvius Flaccus urbanam, M. Valerius Laevinus peregrinam sortem in juris dictione habuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:30:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 30, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:35:5" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 35, 5</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">urbana, peregrina (sc. sors),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:36:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 36, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:10:9 al" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 10, 9 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbana et peregrina (provinciae), quae duorum ante sors fuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:44:2" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 44, 2</bibl>; <pb n="1733" /> <cb n="SORT" /> cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:41:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 41, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitia suae sortis esse,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>had by lot been assigned to him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 6, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, numquam ex urbe afuit nisi sorte,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>on official duty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:27:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 27, 67</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44805.4" n="C" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">an oracular response</hi> (which was often written on a little tablet or lot), <hi rend="ital">a prophecy</hi> (cf. responsum): <cit><quote lang="la">cum (Spartiatae) oraculum ab Jove Dodonaeo petivissent legatique illud, in quo inerant sortes, collocavissent: simia et sortis ipsas et cetera quae erant ad sortem parata, disturbavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:34:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 34, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut interpres egeat interprete et sors ipsa ad sortis referenda sit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 56, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Italiam Lyciae jussere capessere sortes,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>the oracles of the Lycian Apollo</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:346" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 346</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 377</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Phoebeae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faticinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:436" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 436</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:368" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 368</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">11, 412: edita oraculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:1:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 1, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:4:11" default="NO">5, 4, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:9:18" default="NO">6, 9, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:6:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 6, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque responsa sortium ulli alii committere ausus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 56</bibl></cit>: conjecturam postulat, ut se edoceret, Quo sese vertant tantae sortes somniūm, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:21:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 21, 42</bibl> (Trag. v. 64 Vahl.).—</sense><sense id="n44805.5" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">oracular sayings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">verses</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">sentences</hi> at the opening of a book, selected for the purpose: <cit><quote lang="la">sortes Vergilii or Vergilianae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 14, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Had. 2, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:11" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanctorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 8, 9, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sortes tollere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1</bibl></cit>. 1.: <cit><quote lang="la">ducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:583" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 583</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de paginis poëtae cujusdam sortem consulere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 4:3" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de paginis evangelicis sortes legere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 119" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 119</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n44805.6" n="D" level="2"> In gen., like the Engl. <hi rend="ital">lot</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">fate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destiny</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fortune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">condition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">share</hi>, <hi rend="ital">part</hi> (esp. freq. after the Aug. per.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">fors, casus, fortuna): nescia mens hominum fati sortisque futurae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:501" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 501</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrea sors vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:3:28" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vires ultra sortemque senectae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iniqua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 332</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui fit, ut nemo, quam sibi sortem Seu ratio dederit seu fors objecerit, illa Contentus vivat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sperat infestis, metuit secundis Alteram sortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 10, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sors mea fuit irrequieta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:386" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 386</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sors querenda, Non celanda foret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:551" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 551</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:43:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 43, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt quibus ad portas cecidit custodia sorti,</quote> <trans><tr>to whose lot</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 165</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:368" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 368</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines ultimae sortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: non tuae sortis juvenem, <hi rend="ital">of your rank</hi> or <hi rend="ital">condition</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:11:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 11, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sors tua mortalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec cedit nisi sorte mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:529" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 529</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dilectos inter sors prima sodales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:5:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic sortem concede priorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:581" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 581</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quattuor ille quidem juvenes totidemque crearat Femineae sortis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the female sex</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:680" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 6, 680</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">feminea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:651" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 651</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:676" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 676</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:329" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 329</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Saturni sors ego prima fui,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the first child</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suae sortis oblitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:2:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec pars nec sors in sermone isto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 8, 21</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus mali sors incidit Remis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:12:3" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incommodi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:ib. 8:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 1</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobis quoniam prima animi ingenique negata sors est, secundam ac mediam teneamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:29:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 29, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer post avi mortem in nullam sortem bonorum natus (opp. omnium heredi bonorum),</quote> <trans><tr>to no share of the property</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:34:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 34, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedae mala sors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:485" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 485</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrius vitae sortem legant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:6:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servitutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:5:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44805.7" n="2" level="3"> In partic., in mercant. lang. (prop. fortune, money; hence), <hi rend="ital">capital bearing interest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">principal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et sors et fenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 122</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 34</bibl>; 3, 1, 64; 3, 1, 70; 3, 1, 84; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 15</bibl>; Plin. praef. § 23; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:42:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 42, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:2:24" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 2, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4405</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=65" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 65</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5</bibl>, § 183 Müll.—</sense><sense id="n44805.8" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A rank</hi>, <hi rend="ital">class</hi>, <hi rend="ital">order</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">ex turbā imae sortis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 6, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sorsum: <entryFree id="n44806" type="main" key="sorsum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sorsum</orth>, v. seorsum.</entryFree>
sorticula: <entryFree id="n44807" type="main" key="sorti^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sortĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <sense id="n44807.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">f dim.</hi> [sors], <hi rend="ital">a little lot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a small tablet</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ticket</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 590, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">510</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sortientes: <entryFree id="n44808" type="main" key="Sorti^entes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sortĭentes</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. sortior, I.</entryFree>
sortifer: <entryFree id="n44809" type="hapax" key="sorti^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sortĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕri</itype>, <sense id="n44809.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. m.</hi> [sors-fero], <hi rend="ital">giving out oracles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oracular</hi>, an epithet of Jupiter Hammon, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:512" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 512</bibl> (al. sortiger).</sense></entryFree>
sortiger: <entryFree id="n44810" type="main" key="sorti^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sortĭger</orth>, <itype>gĕri</itype>, v. sortifer.</entryFree>
sortilegus: <entryFree id="n44811" type="main" key="sorti^le^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sortĭlĕgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sors-lego</etym>, <sense id="n44811.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">foretelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prophetic.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44811.1" n="I" level="1"> <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">Delphi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 219</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44811.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sortĭlĕgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a fortune-teller</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soothsayer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diviner</hi> by lots or from oracles, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=65" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 65</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:58:132" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 58, 132</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 53, 109</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:581" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 581</bibl>. <cb n="SORT" /></sense></entryFree>
sortio: <entryFree id="n44812" type="main" key="sorti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sortĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <sense id="n44812.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to draw lots</hi> (ante-class.; <cit><quote lang="la">collat. form of sortior): tute sorti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6, 61</bibl>: inter se sortiant, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 471, 5</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: inter se sortiunt urbem atque agros, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 471, 10</bibl> (Trag. v. 153 Vahl.).—</sense><sense id="n44812.1" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sortītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif., <hi rend="ital">drawn by lot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assigned</hi> or <hi rend="ital">obtained by lot</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">consilia, quae erant sortita in singulos candidatos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 16, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 11, 20: <cit><quote lang="la">gemina est sedes sortita per amnem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 7, 55: <cit><quote lang="la">mille urbes Asiae sortito rexerit anno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:2:57" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 2, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjux,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 6, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sortior: <entryFree id="n44813" type="main" key="sorti^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sortĭor</orth>, <itype>ītus, 4</itype>, <sense id="n44813.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [sors]. </sense><sense id="n44813.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cast</hi> or <hi rend="ital">draw lots</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">coniciam sortes in sitellam et sortiar Tibi et Chalino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 5, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum praetores designati sortirentur et M. Metello obtigisset, ut is de pecuniis repetundis quaereret,</quote> <trans><tr>drew lots for the judges</tr>, <tr>appointed the judges by lot</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 8, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:10:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 10, 1</bibl>: consules comparare inter se aut sortiri jussi, <hi rend="ital">to draw lots</hi> for the provinces, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:35:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 35, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sortiti nocte singuli per ordinem intrārunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:72" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum legiones de ordine agminis sortiuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de altero consulatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 7</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sor-tĭentes</orth>, <hi rend="ital">The Lot-drawers</hi> (a transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*klhrou/menoi</foreign>), the name of a comedy by Diphilus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. prol. 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44813.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to draw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cast lots for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fix</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assign</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">appoint by lot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to allot;</hi> also esp. in the perfect tenses, <hi rend="ital">to obtain</hi> or <hi rend="ital">receive by lot</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n44813.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provinciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provincias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 13, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duas Gallias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut consules inter se provincias compararent sortirenturve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:17:section=42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 17, § 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 18, § 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">judices per praetorem urbanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquos ad ignominiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:46:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 46, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:17:section=42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 17, § 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec regna vini sortiere talis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 4, 18</bibl></cit>: aequā lege Necessitas Sortitur insignes et imos, <hi rend="ital">decides the fate of</hi>, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">peregrinam (provinciam) sortitus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex praeturā ulteriorem sortitus Hispaniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n44813.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut P. Furius et Cn. Servilius inter se sortirentur, uter citeriorem Hispaniam obtineret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consules sortiti, uter dedicaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 8, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 10, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uter patriā decederet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:1:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sortiri, quid loquare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:35:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 35, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">num sortiuntur inter se, quae declinet, quae non?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:20:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 20, 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44813.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n44813.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To share</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distribute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pariter laborem Sortiti,</quote> <trans><tr>shared the labor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:445" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 445</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vices,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 634</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 174</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44813.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To choose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">select</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subolem armento sortire quot annis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunam (i.e. locum) oculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:920" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 920</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matrimonium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:3:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 26, 3, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44813.8" n="3" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to obtain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">receive</hi> a thing (mostly in the <hi rend="ital">tempp. perff.;</hi> not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">Tectosagi mediterranea Asiae sortiti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si emancipatus uxore ducta filium fuerit sortitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:4:3:section=5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 37, 4, 3, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens Claudia regnum in plebem sortita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 92</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si Maeonium vatem sortita fuisses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:6:21" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 6, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 241</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 124</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 758</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:99 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 99 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidam sortiti metuentem sabbata patrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:96" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venerabile ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:144" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 15, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fata tam tristia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Phoen. 245" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Phoen. 245</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliqua rerum tuarum post te alium atque alium dominum sortientur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit> Döring ad loc.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. part.</hi> sortitus, v. sortio <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sortītō</orth>, <hi rend="ital">by lot</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacerdotem sortito capere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:51:section=126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 51, § 126</bibl></cit>; S. C. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 8, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">47</bibl>.— <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">by fate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by destiny</hi> (= sorte, or lege naturae): <cit><quote lang="la">tibi sortito id obtigit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:4:1" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 4, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sortis: <entryFree id="n44814" type="main" key="sortis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sortis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, v. sors <sense id="n44814.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sortitio: <entryFree id="n44815" type="main" key="sorti_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sortītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sortior</etym>, <sense id="n44815.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a casting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">drawing of lots</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a choosing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">determining by lot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sortition</hi> (class.): deos quaeso, mihi ut sortitio eveniat, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum aequantur sortes, dum sortitio fit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Cornel. Fragm. 1, 13, p. 449</bibl></cit> Orell.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:17:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 17, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedilicia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:22:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 22, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praerogativa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:33:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 33, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provinciarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 10, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:46:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 46, 128</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:35 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 35 al.</bibl>; <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 29</bibl>. <cb n="SOSP" /></sense></entryFree>
sortito: <entryFree id="n44816" type="main" key="sorti_to_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sortītō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. sortior <sense id="n44816.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sortitor: <entryFree id="n44817" type="hapax" key="sorti_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sortītor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sortior</etym>, <sense id="n44817.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who casts</hi> or <hi rend="ital">drdws lots</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 982" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 982</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sortitus: <entryFree id="n44818" type="main" key="sorti_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sortītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of sortior.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n44819" type="main" key="sorti_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sortītus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sortior</etym>. <sense id="n44819.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a casting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">drawing of lots</hi> (rare for the class. sortitio): <cit><quote lang="la">specula in sortitu'st mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 4, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si pluribus de rebus uno sortitu retulisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:19:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 19, 50</bibl></cit>; <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae sortitus non pertulit ullos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>for whom no lots were cast</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:323" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 323</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44819.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> * </sense><sense id="n44819.2" n="A" level="2"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a lot</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam sortitus versarat ahenā Casside,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:389" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 389</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n44819.3" n="B" level="2"> (Like sors, II. C.) <hi rend="ital">Lot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destiny</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:557" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 557</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sory: <entryFree id="n44820" type="greek" key="so_ry"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōry</orth>, <itype>ĕos</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sw=ru</foreign>, <sense id="n44820.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of ore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ink-stone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sory</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 12, 29, § 117</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:120" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 12, 30, § 120</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 9, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sos: <entryFree id="n44821" type="main" key="sos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sos</orth>, arch. contr. form. <sense id="n44821.0" n="1" level="3"> For eos; v. is <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n44821.1" n="2" level="3"> For suos; v. suus <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sosagoras: <entryFree id="n44822" type="main" key="So_sa^go^ras"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sōsăgŏras</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*swsago/ras</foreign>, <sense id="n44822.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek physician</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:18:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 18, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sosia: <entryFree id="n44823" type="main" key="So_si^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sōsĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44823.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a servant</hi>, in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 209</bibl>, and <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> And 1, 1, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 50, 63</bibl>.—The same, called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sōsĭas</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ephem. Egress. 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sosianus: <entryFree id="n44824" type="main" key="So_si^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sōsĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Sosius.</entryFree>
sosigenes: <entryFree id="n44825" type="main" key="So_si^ge^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sōsĭgĕnes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*swsige/nhs</foreign>, <sense id="n44825.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a famous astronomer employed by Julius Cœsar in reforming the calendar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 6, § 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:211" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 25, 57, § 211</bibl> sqq.</sense></entryFree>
sosilus: <entryFree id="n44826" type="main" key="So_si^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sōsĭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44826.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Lacedœmonian who instructed Hannibal in Greek literature and recorded his exploits</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 13, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sosippus: <entryFree id="n44827" type="main" key="So_sippus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sōsippus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44827.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:9:section=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 9, § 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sosis: <entryFree id="n44828" type="main" key="So_sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sōsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44828.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek proper name</hi>, e. g. L. Manlius Sosis Catinensis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 30, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sositheus: <entryFree id="n44829" type="main" key="So_si^the^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sōsĭthĕus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*swsi/qeos</foreign>, <sense id="n44829.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek proper name.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44829.1" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A slave whose death grieved Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 12, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44829.2" n="2" level="3"> Sositheus Entellinus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:87:section=200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 87, § 200</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sosius: <entryFree id="n44830" type="main" key="So^si^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŏsĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44830.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens. </sense><sense id="n44830.1" n="1" level="3"> C. Sosius, <hi rend="ital">a quœstor under</hi> M' Lepidus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 6, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44830.2" n="2" level="3"> Another C. Sosius, <hi rend="ital">consul</hi> 722 A.U.C., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44830.3" n="3" level="3"> Q. Sosius, <hi rend="ital">a knight of Picenum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:30:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 30, 74</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44830.4" n="4" level="3"> Sosii, <hi rend="ital">famous booksellers in Rome in the time of Horace</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:345" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 345</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŏsĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Sosius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Sosian</hi>: Apollo, <hi rend="ital">an image of Apollo brought from Seleucia to Rome by the quœstor</hi> C. Sosius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 5, 11, § 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:28" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 5, 4, § 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sospes: <entryFree id="n44831" type="main" key="sospe^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sospĕs</orth>, <itype>ĭtis</itype> (<sense id="n44831.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fem.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">sospĭ-ta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and arch. SISPITA, ae, and SEISPES, ĭtis; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>for sos-pets; root <foreign lang="greek">sa/os, sw=s</foreign>; and pa-, to nourish, protect; cf. pasco</etym>. </sense><sense id="n44831.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">saving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delivering; subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a savior</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deliverer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preserver</hi> (so only in the foll. examples): <cit><quote lang="la">Ennius sospitem pro servatore posuit, Fest. pp. 300 and 301 Müll.: templum Junonis Sospitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; so, Sospita, <hi rend="ital">an epithet of Juno</hi> (the Gr. Hygieia). <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:29:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 29, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:41:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 41, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:56" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 56</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">in the form SISPITA,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1309</bibl></cit>; Num. ap. Eckh. D. N. V. 7, pp. 14 and 107; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sispitem Junonem, quam vulgo sospitem appellant, antiqui usurpabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=343" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 343</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">IVNONE SEISPITEI MATRI REGINAE,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 5659</bibl></cit> a; <cit><quote lang="la">the same abbreviated I. S. M. R. (IVNO SISPITA MATER REGINA),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1308</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2503</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3324</bibl>; 4014.—</sense><sense id="n44831.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">saved</hi>, i.e. <hi rend="ital">safe and sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">safe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unhurt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unharmed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uninjured; happy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lucky</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fortunate</hi> (syn.: salvus, incolumis, sanus, salvus; mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): filium tuum modo in portu vivum, salvum et sospitem vidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exagoga (with salva),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: ita mihi salvam ac sospitem rempublicam sistere in sede suā liceat August. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:28" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sospes et superstes gnatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">sospes incolumisque (Caesar),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:67:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 67, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sospes Iter incipe hoc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sospites in patriam restituere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:49:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 49, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 28, 4</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">virginum matres juvenumque nuper Sospitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:14:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 14, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hesperiā sospes ab ultima,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 36, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix una sospes navis ab ignibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 37, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna do. musque Sospes ab incursu est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:401" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 401</bibl></cit>: Juppiter, da diem hunc sospitem Rebus meis agundis, <hi rend="ital">favorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">auspicious</hi>, <pb n="1734" /> <cb n="SPAD" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutare lares et urbem Sospite cursu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:40" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C. S. 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sospita: <entryFree id="n44832" type="main" key="Sospi^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sospĭta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. sospes, I.</entryFree>
sospitalis: <entryFree id="n44833" type="main" key="sospi^ta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sospĭtālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sospes</etym>, <sense id="n44833.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">giving health</hi> or <hi rend="ital">safety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">salutary</hi> (ante- and postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">qui tibi sospitalis fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sospitas: <entryFree id="n44834" type="main" key="sospi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sospĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n44834.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">safety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">health</hi>, <hi rend="ital">welfare</hi> (late Lat.; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. pestis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 17 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sospitatem significantia cognomina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 17</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">indicium sospitatis meae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 3:71" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 3, 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:8" default="NO">4, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 5, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sospitator: <entryFree id="n44835" type="main" key="sospi^ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sospĭtātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sospito</etym>, <sense id="n44835.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a savior</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preserver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deliverer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">redeemer</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 185</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9</bibl>, p. 218; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mag. p. 315, 38</bibl>.—Of Christ: <cit><quote lang="la">nostri generis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 96</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
